Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very good timeshare”
Reviews.Author: Bob U
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Timeshare owner, we've stayed in some very nice places, and they've all been excellent. If you're not a timeshare owner, and you're renting a room here instead of a hotel, you'll love it. If you're used to other Marriott Timeshares, this place is very nice, I do recommend it, but it's not a Marriott 5 star timeshare. The room was excellent, the grounds were excellent, nice pool, and ammenities. However, unlike other timeshares, this lacked onsite food and grocery service. Yes, they had a snackbar by the pool, can get hotdogs and such, but only till 5pm. They had a little "store" area inside the lobby, but it was no bigger then my master bedroom walk in closet. For many people, this is fine, however, staying at other Marriot Timeshares with "The Marketplace", where you can get a wide assortment of foods, drinks, hot coffee, danishes, cakes, snacks, etc, this was a disappointment. Also no onsite bar or restaurant. Now, I'm not saying I would not come back here, I would. Just that it's not as nice as others. This place, even though it was in a busy town like Branson, was VERY QUIET, you felt like you were in a lodge in the middle of no where. Quiet and peaceful. Hard to believe that just a few hundred feet or so down the road was tons of hotels, 100's of shows and attractions. The outdoor pool was fantastic! Very large, multiple sections, with lots of sitting areas. Plus an indoor pool, indoor hot tub, and 2 outside hot tubs. Also, multiple gas BBQ's around the area to cook your own burgers or steaks if you wish. The staff was decent, the room were great, all modern large flat screen tv's, full kitchens, nice bath and master bedroom. If you're a family, looking to enjoy the many things Branson has to offer, this place is for you. Very family/kid friendly. If you're an older couple like us, looking for a quiet week away from home, or looking to catch some on the shows, you'll enjoy it just as much. So, I could have given this a 5, but after staying at other Marriott timeshares, this place is a notch below, but still excellent quality, and a great place to stay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Two bedrooms- Great for 2 couples vacationing together!!”
Reviews.Author: Kate H
Reviews.Content: We brought our friends with us on our trip to Branson and were pleased to have 2 bedrooms with 2 bathrooms! We could watch TV as couples in our bedrooms or as a group in the living room. We also had a full kitchen in which to store the perishable treasures we captured while on our vacation. What a terrific place- It was clean comfortable and very accomodating!!

Reviews.Title: “At Home Resort”
Reviews.Author: Alisha S
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this resort. There were many activities to attend and they really make you feel at home in their king suite! The large whirpool was perfect for us and we plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Willow Ridge”
Reviews.Author: BradyWanderer
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The concierge was one of the best I have ever used. Will definitely stay at this hotel again if we are ever back in the area. This location is much more than a hotel, it is a resort. The pool and grounds are spotless. Whether teravelling on business orpleasure, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. The only issue with this hotel was no onsite restaurant. You can order sandwiches by the pool but no formal meals. Still, this is one of ther better hotels in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasDad1836
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and decided to give this resort a try. Very, very nice, well-kept property. Check-in staff made no effort to persuade me to sit through a timeshare presentation. One-bedroom villa was very well appointed. Nice balcony with room to spread out. Nice kitchen area and comfortable den. King bed was quite comfortable. Well worth the price, given the extra amenities. This may be our new "home" in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot in Branson”
Reviews.Author: rich p
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a nice visit at the Willow Ridge Lodge. We were very pleased with all aspects of the trip. The staff was very nice and attentive to our needs. We enjoyed the pool area, weight room and played a little Texas Hold em. We were able to see a show while in Branson and we STRONGLY suggest seeing the show SIX. It was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Spacious, Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: LoveCaribbean3
Reviews.Content: This is our first time in Branson, so I can't compare this to other hotels in Branson, but we have stayed at 3 separate Marriott Vacation Club resorts so I do have that to compare to. This resort is very nice. It's spacious and comfortable. I can tell this resort is a bit older than the other two we've been to (St. Kitts Beach Club and Harbour Lake in Orlando), but it is still very nice. We have a 2 bedroom with a balcony and it seems they have given us a one bedroom suite that has a connecting door to a one bedroom studio suite (includes small kitchen). I really like this set up, even more so than the other two places we've been because my Mom came with me so she really had her own separate space, with a kitchen. The pool is very nice, but smaller than I anticipated. The website says there are four pools...really it's 2 large pools and 2 kiddie pools. There is a large main pool outside with a hot tub and a fenced in kiddie pool outside, which we were grateful for with a four and one year old. I do wish there was a shade of some sort at the outdoor kiddie pool, as it did get a bit bright and hot for my munchkins. The indoor area is just a large pool with a very small separate kiddie pool and another hot tub. We didn't need to use it, but I appreciate that they have it for the cooler seasons. The lobby and store isn't much to write home about. There are some lincoln logs that entertained my kids during check in, but that's about it. They do have activities for the kids and a small (basically just a slide) playground. I personally think they should move that slide over to the kiddie pool to add shade and a little more entertainment in the water. All in all, we enjoyed our stay very much. We stayed on the fifth floor of the fifth building and had a very nice view. We will certainly be returning to this property in the future. I gave a "lower" score for service, simply because everyone was nice but not overly helpful. We didn't get very many tips when we asked for advice on local activities to do with kids. They just said the "Fish hatchery" and that was it. We discovered the train ride and the boat cruise on our own and basically just went out looking for things to do. They just gave us a map of the area. The resort does not have a restaurant and we did not order room service (not even sure they have it), so I really couldn't give any scores on that. I did, however, see a Jimmy John's delivery directly to the pool and a few pizza deliveries going up the elevator. There are a lot of restaurants near the hotel, a Subway across the street, a McDonalds & Walmart just about a mile away and 2 miniature golf courses right by the hotel as well. Lots to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience”
Reviews.Author: Chantalfnp
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here and my family again had a wonderful time. We stayed in a 2 BR suite which was very spacious. King bed (very comfy) with adjoining bath in one room and 2 queen beds with adjoining bath in the other. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. Lots of family activities. Staff is very helpful. Movie night was a lot of fun. This is the only place I want to stay in Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly, family facility was fabulous. (No Fibbing)”
Reviews.Author: Paul-From-NY
Reviews.Content: Nine days at Willow Ridge proved to be a good choice at this splendid family resort. We were constantly moments away from every activity in Branson. You wouldn’t know it. The facility is hidden like an oasis in the commercial dessert. The grounds are immaculate and the rooms spotless. The Missouri theme included quilts on the wall and picnic tables made to look like they were built from logs. The main building was terrific. Ping pong, video games, foosball, craft room, indoor pool and Jacuzzi are some of the activities ready to use. There’s a giant screen room were movies are shown and a popcorn maker 50 feet away. Concierge (Sharon) was beyond helpful. It took her at least a Nano-second to come up with 4 ideas for each of our requests and hand over a color coded map with a smile. Actually, the entire staff was a pleasure. The outdoor pool is excellent. Balls and floats are welcome to make playtime fun for kids and adults. It’s large and picturesque with a water fall that feeds the pool. We’ve been to many family vacations and half a dozen Vacation Clubs. It’s true this one isn’t the most modern but as one of the staff said. “You’ll have a good time. We’ll see to it!” Big thumbs up for Willow Ridge Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: missymalloo
Reviews.Content: We traded in with a timeshare to stay in a 2-bedroom condo. The units are huge with two queen beds in one room and a king in the other. There are two bathrooms and a well appointed kitchen and living room area. We enjoyed the pool area which is spacious. The grounds are beautifully kept. We also played shuffleboard and tried some other games. We also liked the smores campfire that was provided for the guests. There are only 4 of us but we could have slept 8 here, I think. This is kind of set back from the main road and so it doesn't feel busy at all. Relaxing by the pool, it felt like we were at a luxury resort. This isn't as busy of a week but the weather is just perfect for enjoying the water. We also liked the popcorn they provide every afternoon. We have stayed in many timeshares and this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Oasis just 2 blocks off Branson strip”
Reviews.Author: wegolfn
Reviews.Content: We have been to Branson many times & stayed on the strip in just averages hotels. We did some exploring & found this beautiful place to bring the family. The resort had everything here except a restaurant . They have 2 outdoor pools & 2 hot tubs with a cabana open 11-5 with sandwiches & drinks. They had shuffleboard ,horseshoes ,a whiffleball & basketball court. They had an indoor pool & hot tub. Ping pong, Foosball, pool table & much more to keep kids & adults happy. Starbucks in the lobby, movies on a big screen different times of the day. Planned activities to keep everyone entertained. We partook in the s'mores by the campfire in the evening. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/ 2 bath condo. The bathroom in the master bedroom was set up very nice. The beds were very comfy & fluffy. We had a balcony with a great view. Very roomy for 4 adults & 2 kids The staff was very helpful & friendly especially Denise & Heather at the front desk. I will definitely be back & just hang out at the resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we got a discount...”
Reviews.Author: Treasy1
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Marriott's whenever possible for the assurance of a nice clean room. Yes the room was indeed clean. The set up was a little awkward. We stayed in a lock off. The placement of sink in TV area was a little odd. Bed was comfy. The rooms can use some upgrades. Old fixtures in the bathroom took away from the comfort level. TV reception wasn't good. Overall the property offered many amenities. Basketball court, Game room with ping pong table, Daily resort activities, Great pool. Indoor and outdoor. Fairly nice location on "the strip" Nice place to go for a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Crispe123
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Branson, this is the nicest hotel in Branson! Check in was in a 4pm we called at 12pm. Just to see if we could check in early, they got us in- how awesome was that ! The rooms were emaculent- they had our pool towels in our room. So we were ready to go swimming ! We used all the amenities , tether ball and basketball court (ck out the balls at the front desk) The game area ping pong, fooseball, board games , pool table and table size checkers. It was one of the nicest resorts we have stayed at. A must visit!

Reviews.Title: “Branson family vacation”
Reviews.Author: margiepiano
Reviews.Content: Was at Willow Ridge Lodge from Aug 5-12. Had 3 rooms reserved and was pleased that they were all located in the same building and on the same floor. The staff is very helpful and the villas spacious and clean. Enjoyed the smores by the campfire in the evening and singing karoke by the pool one afternoon. Great location and lots to see and do in Branson. All 10 of us had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Above the Top Staff!”
Reviews.Author: IowaDisneyMom
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott owners at Marriott's Cypress Harbour in Orlando but decided to save $ on airfare and travel closer to home this summer. We decided to swap our week for Branson. Willow Ridge Lodge is beautiful. Set back off the strip, very quiet and secluded. The property is not huge like the properties in Orlando which is good but also has its drawbacks. We traveled with 3 teens. There was a small basketball court, pool table, ping pong table, foosball and games to check out to your room. Nice outdoor pool as well as an indoor one. We missed the organized activities for teenagers as the ones in Orlando have. I understand this is a small property but in the summer, there are more families that travel. Our 2 bedroom, 2 bath villa was clean. We had to call maintenance for a small issue and they were there immediately. Front desk staff was always helpful with a smile. The lifeguards and The Hitchin' Post staff were great. We had a "walk-out" in Building 1. The pool at night was pretty with the changing colored lights. We could not get the temperature in the villa to a comfortable setting for everyone. One room would be freezing while the other quite warm.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: sjensen81
Reviews.Content: My first time at this location. Sits back off the road. We had a two bedroom villa for 2 nights. Our son's family met us there and the grandkids had a great time. Very nice pool, not too crowded even on the weekend. 6 in the room and we never felt crowded. Great service, great, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED, LOVED, LOVED the Marriott Willow Ridge!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FourMors
Reviews.Content: I am a "hotel snob" but I absolutely LOVED this place!!!! It was very up to date (unlike most hotels in Branson) and it was VERY CLEAN!! The staff and service was fantastic too!!! We loved the beautiful outdoor pool as well as all the amenities the 1 bedroom Villa offered. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this as the BEST place to stay in Branson!!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful 5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: tamaradmProspectOhio
Reviews.Content: our family of four stayed five nights, july 29th thru august 3rd. we were in the 5th building room 5515, one bedroom villa. the room itself was very nice, no complaints. kitchen fully stocked with any utensil you might need. we bought a few groceries at the wal-mart just down the way, snacks, soda, water, breakfast and sandwich food. the pool area was very nice and the kids loved it. this week was super hot, temps in the 100's. night time swimming was the best. the resort has many activities going on all the time. kids took part in pool games, ice scream sundae bar, crafts, painting, etc. at one point my son and i got locked out onto our balcony (husband/daughter did it on accident). we were able to flag down another guest who called hotel security for us (mike) who came and let us "out." another time our room key deactivated, we were locked out of the room and again, mike, helped us out again. can't thank him enough! they only draw back that i could see was there is no restaurant on site. there was a stand that served a limited menu, sandwiches, chips, nachos...but it was only serving until 6p. would have been nice to not have to leave the property each night for dinner but many restaurants are close by. we recommend the dixie stampede, the "ride the duck" tour, the titantic museum, ripley's believe it or not museum. we did putt-putt a couple different times. we had never been to branson but would return again and definitely stay at willow ridge. all staff members were so nice and helpful. thanks for a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: INmidwife
Reviews.Content: As a loyal Marriott customer I hope to never have to write this review again. It is the first time I've been disappointed in a Marriott property, not for what it is, but for what I expected. Owning two weeks of Marriott Vacation Club property I've become accustom to the high standards and excellent accommodations provided. We have stayed regularly in Williamsburg, VA, Hilton Head, SC, and Orlando where our expectation were exceeded. I reserved two and a half units in Branson with expectation of the same quality of property that we purchased. Willow Ridge apparently was a Horizon by Marriott property in it's first life and an attempt is being made to reinvent it into a Marriott Vacation Club property. Our units were clean but smaller than the normal Marriott Vacation Club property, a significant detail when you are bringing 9 adults and 5 children on a vacation. The overall appointments of the unit are of much lower quality than where I own. The property is smaller than it appears in the pictures with one large pool and two hot tubs. To add insult to injury I requested handicapped accessible rooms for my grandson who is in a wheelchair, upon checking in this request was not found and not able to be accommodated without separating our party. During business and personal travel I utilize every type of Marriott property, from Fairfield Inns to Renaissance, depending on what my needs and plans are. Usually you can dependably predict what you are purchasing but this is a situation where feel deceived and taken advantage of. I purchased and annually pay for a high quality units and received a medium priced property instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: Would have liked to have more time at the hotel. We only had a one night stay as we were driving from MI to TX and wanted to check out Branson. The hotel was very nice with numerous things to do like indoor and outdoor pools, exercise room, pool table and foosball table. We were on the first floor facing the parking lot. Room was great, very spacious with a kitchen, washer/dryer, dining area, sofa and a large tv. Seperate bedroom with very comfortable bed and also had a tv. The bathroom was clean but not that spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice week”
Reviews.Author: Rich K
Reviews.Content: Clean. Nice pool....big, plenty of room for all. Spacious rooms with kitchen and washer and dryer. Indoor pool was open late. Activities for the kids and adults throughout each day. Sat around the fire at night. Enjoyed our stay very much. Most of our vacations are spent running around like crazy....this time we relaxed here, going to the pool everyday. Made breakfast & lunch in our rooms and ate out every night. Close to everything you need. Air conditioning worked very well and it was very hot the week we stayed. No complaints. Go and enjoy. Staff was always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not that special”
Reviews.Author: Rockyell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights last week and it was just okay. The bed was comfortable and room just standard. The property overall seemed nice with amenities but the pool area was a lot smaller than the pictures looked and not that great. Overall not that spectacular but good for Branson. Final note, it is noisy. Due to open hallways, and concrete floors, when people walking or opening/shutting doors it echoes and is very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Naganalf1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Marriott Willow Ridge Lodge for our family reunion with family coming from CO, IN and NC. What a great choice! There were activities every day for people of all ages. We enjoyed s'mores by a fire, karaoke, a basketball shoot out, ice cream socials, etc.... The pool area is really nice and there are a lot of family friendly amenities including ping pong, foos ball, billiards, shuffle board, a game room, a theater room with movies every night, an indoor pool, etc. The 2 bedroom / 2 bath units were simple but well furnished - my bed was super comfortable! The lodge is centrally located with attractions easy to find. The staff at the lodge were so wonderfully friendly and helpful! Table Rock lake nearby is a great attraction! I highly recommend this facility!

Reviews.Title: “Way exceeded expectations for my family.”
Reviews.Author: Tgr4
Reviews.Content: The pool was fabulous, so many different activities for my kids to do, it was veryclean, and I felt like the staff truly wanted me to have a great time. Very family oriented!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: Cooloff2012
Reviews.Content: Great place for famiIes, large rooms and activities like s'mores and movies for the kids a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere else to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: tsgc2008
Reviews.Content: Sitting at the pool on our last day as I write this. Had a great time for a family reunion. The pool area is great to hang out lots of things to do for the kids the fire pit for s'mores was awesome. Spacious rooms comfy beds nice views. Good workout facility. Overall great time. Will Stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: Angie F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Willow Ridge Lodge this past weekend, and had a wonderful time. The property is perfect for families with children of all ages. The grounds are really nice, and well kept. The place was packed while we were there (it was a summer weekend), but I felt there was plenty of space for everyone. There is a LARGE pool area plus separate kiddie pool and two hot tub areas. A big game room with arcade games as well as ping pong and Foosball is fun for older kids and adults. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa and it was very large with full kitchen, washer/dryer, and a big bathroom, and private balcony. There were a lot of fun events (movies, crafts, make your own sundae, pool games, smores at the firepit) for the kids the entire time we we were there, and at check in we were provided with a schedule for each day. There is a snack bar called the "Hitchin' Post" poolside. It has a limited menu, but offers a good variety of drinks plus hotdogs, nachos, and quesadillas at reasonable prices. There is also the standard Marriott Marketplace on site where you can purchase snacks, but the prices are pretty high. We were really impressed with the resort and would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: amd78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this resort on a family trip. My sister and her husband and their two boys along with my husband, me and our son stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom villa. It was very clean and big enough for three kids to play in and not make too much noise. Our parents stayed in one of the "regular" rooms and it was also very cozy. One complaint is the temperature might be hard to regulate in the rooms. In our room, we were freezing cold from the air conditioner but the other bedroom complained about it being hot. The room was very clean and well stocked with towels and other amenities. Housekeeping was very friendly and we had a wonderful view of the pool.The pool was cool and refreshing and all of our kids loved splashing in the children's pools and going to the arcade. It is also centrally located; convenient to everything! There is no restaurant on site as they cater to timeshare owners but there are plenty of restaurants nearby and plenty of grills on the property. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Willow Ridge”
Reviews.Author: 2butterfly
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Branson mid-June to celebrate our anniversary with two other couples. Marriott's Willow Ridge Lodge was the perfect place to stay. It is in a convenient location with easy access to everything although a car is definitely needed in this town to get around. Our unit was a little noisey as we could hear our neighbor's conversations through our fan duct in the bathroom, but otherwise, it was perfect with a washer/dryer in the unit. Kristi, one of the concierges, was wonderful in guiding us to shows and other activities. We especially liked the shows Six and Liverpool Legends. Be sure to take a ride to Springfield to visit Dogwood Canyon Nature Park and to Lampe to tour Fantastic Caverns. Both places can be toured by tram. Don't miss Sunday brunch at the College of the Ozarks. It's more pricey than other local places, but the food is spectacular. They also fixed a special gluten-free meal for our friend who needs to be on a gluten-free diet. Would definitely stay at Marriott's Willow Ridge Lodge if we return to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Vaca_Guru80
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just came home from staying at Willow Ridge from Sat. 6/30 thru Sat. 7/07 and we miss it already, we had such a great time. The resort is set just off the strip but is very quiet and you feel secluded even though you're still close to all the Branson action. We stayed in a 1 Bedroom Villa and it was the perfect size for our family with a 3 1/2 year old and a 10 month old. The room was very clean and well furnished. They provided a highchair and porta-crib for my baby which was so nice. My 3 year old slept on the pull-out couch. The kitchen was fully equipped and stocked with everything you need to make and eat meals. Which we did everyday. We cooked 1 meal a day, breakfast, lunch and a dinner. Since they do not have a on site restaurant here's a tip, go to Big Cedar Lodge the Worman House for Sunday Brunch. It's a little pricey but so worth it and really delicious. Kids under 4 eat free ;) The pool was perfect. There is a separate gated kiddie pool that has a zero depth entry and max depth of 1.5 feet so my 10 month old and 3 year old loved it. The other larger pool was gorgeous and never over crowded. It also has a zero depth entry which my 3 year old loved. The Hitchin' Post is the pool side cabana restaurant, opened from 11 to 6. It serves panini sandwiches and hotdogs with a variety of toppings, quesadillas, snacks, ice cream. Get the souvenir cup of shaved ice and refill it for a $1. There is so much to do. The resort constantly has activities planned everyday, all day for all ages. Aqua aerobics, wine glass painting, ice cream time, poker, movies on their big screen. We did the free smores one night and my son got to paint a piggy bank to bring home for just 5 bucks. Two things I want to mention that I did not like about Willow Ridge. First, they do not have any spa services on site. I would have loved to have a massage while my Hubby watched the boys for an hour. When I called to ask if they provide the service they directed me offsite to a spa. :-/ Second, if you wanted to have your towels exchanged you would be charged, 1 Bedroom Villa $8, Two Bedroom Villa $12. With a family of four you need clean towels after a few days. We decided to wash them ourselves since the room has a washer dryer unit. Also, maid service is not provided to the Villas during your stay. Again, you would be charged. Tidy service $15 or $25, Full Clean $45 or $62. Really?? Once during our week stay it would have been nice to have our room cleaned. I do have to say that I called the 2nd to last day we were there and complained that we had no toilet paper left and that our tub was filthy and asked for cleaning supplies. They instead sent two maids out and cleaned our bathtub and provided tp, no charge :) Staff is extremely nice and very helpful. I'd like to come back to Branson when my kids are little older and can definitively see ourselves staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SammyJL
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there this week - our second time in three years - rooms were clean as were facilities - indoor lap pool and outdoor pool were great - staff was helpful and courteous on site dining would be a great addition as would the ability for late check out

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort in Branson”
Reviews.Author: iGrade
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it is a resort. My family and I just stayed there the weekend before July 4th in a one bedroom villa. We couldn't be happier with the stay; clean rooms, nice pool, activities for kids and great location. It truly felt like you were at a remote wilderness location but you are actually located in the center of Branson. The next trip back we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dayton0919
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Marriott Willow Ridge Lodge. The lodge is in a great location. We had a two bedroom, two bath suite on the fifth floor and it was wonderful. The suite was spacious and very clean. The kitchen was well furnished. We could not have asked for a nicer place to stay while in Branson. The kids enjoyed the pool and the kids' rec room. The staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and a perfect place for vacation”
Reviews.Author: lestep62704
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff is always welcoming and helpful, and the resort has so many things to do you don't even have to leave the relaxing atmosphere. The outdoor pool and hot tubs are always fun, and the activities including big screen movies, bingo, pool races, and more keep the entire family entertained. There is always something to do and the concierge staff is more than accomodating with any shows you want to go see or tickets that you need. The new Hitchin' Post outdoor cafe provides some tasty choices for lunch or an early dinner, and plenty of ice cold refreshments for adults and kids alike.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Getaway for Grandchildren”
Reviews.Author: gogrammygo
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Marriott Willow Ridge Lodge in Branson, MO. We could not have been more pleased. The room was clean and very well furnished and stocked with linens, kitchen dishes and utensils. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Everything is up to date. The pool area was perfect for the grandchildren. It is a large pool and has a life guard. There were two hot pools (not just round tubs). There is also a big indoor pool and another indoor hot tub. The food was also very good. We all had a great time and would definitely stay there again. This location is so close to the strip and yet there is no road noise. The staff was very helpful with any questions. We have a Marriott timeshare, but this was our first visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: missyjo25
Reviews.Content: I've honestly spent a lot of time trying to come up with one negative thing about the Willow Ridge Lodge and could come up with absolutely NOTHING! We had a wonderful stay. First of all, the location is excellent. Close to shopping, restaurants and attractions but feels secluded. We stayed in a standard room and it was immaculate. There was extra towels and we had a high floor just as requested. The bed was very comfortable, so much that we researched the mattress to consider buying one just like it! Housekeeping did a fantastic job. Our sons slept on the pull out sofabed and my husband somewhat made the bed. In other words, he pretty much threw the blanket and sheets on. We were so surprised the next day when we returned to the room and found the sofabed all made up! There was a large amount of channels on the tv- SEVEN HBO's! Another big plus- NO noise whatsoever! It was perfectly quiet in the evening and in the morning. Every place that we encountered during our stay was clean and well maintained. We even saw a maintenance man cleaning the elevator one morning! We visited the outdoor pool daily and it was amazing! There was plenty of places to sit and relax and there were areas for both our older kids and our one year old. In addition, there is an indoor pool and kiddy pool. There's also a small arcade and an area with board games, pool and ping pong. Daily activites and movies are also available. We've already decided to return to the Willow Ridge Lodge next year!!! Highly, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: camillenesler
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort! My parents have a time-share here and go every two years and we often go with them. The units are gorgeous and really clean, and the pool area is awesome, you almost feel like you're in a tropical resort. It has 3 hottubs which are really large, and one is indoors along with an indoor pool. Also enjoyed the poolside snack shack. Great resort and will definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “A few quirks”
Reviews.Author: Freddy4
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Marriott's Willow Ridge Lodge. Pros: location is right in the center of Branson-close to Titanic Museum and all the stuff on the main drag. The pool at the resort was wonderful. Excellent kitchen and was fully stocked. Daily maid service! Cons: The 'King bed' was a bit smaller than what we are used to. I'm not sure how this could be but it definitely was a smaller width than our king at home. Shower water pressure is pathetic. Elevators are a bit slow. We needed to print out some documents and fax them back and the business center charged .35 a MINUTE!!! for internet usage. Now I would have just emailed the documents to the front desk from my phone but the documents were a bit large and I couldn't send them from my phone. I wasn't about to waste whatever amount it would take to get internet on their computer. Lastly, when checking in we enquired as to a few of the shows. When asked about Dixie Stampede, (which we were really excited about, and loved after going) the concierge said it wasn't her cup of tea and that she liked 50's and 60's rock and roll! I found this to be inappropriate. A concierge should give you a run down of shows not her own likes and dislikes. We were in Branson with a 9 year old. 50's and 60's rock and roll was not gonna fly. Would stay again, but wont use concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong and nothing special”
Reviews.Author: terryhd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an efficiency unit just before memorial day. For an efficiancy it had plenty of space and was clean and kept up well. They only do room service once per seven days unless you pay extra which I did ($10)midway through to tidy up room. The staff will help if you have questions although there is no "pampering" services. Plenty of free parking. We were there just before busy season and the place seemed almost empty which made pool time very relaxing. My daughter loved the pools and they even had a couple large hottub/whirlpools that I much liked. They provided pool towels which is always nice. The place is right in town so you are just a couple minutes away from all that Branson has to offer. Although I am spoiled and like a little pampering I would stay here again as it was zero hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: 100Paige
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Marriott resorts, we had some idea of what to expect from this resort - and were happy to find that it lived up to Marriott standards. We had two 2-bedroom suites and were quite pleased with the accommodations. They were clean, nicely furnished, and well equipped. The staff was friendly and helpful. The grounds of the resort were well maintained, and there were plenty of activities available for the kids (although the outdoor pool was closed for the winter). The location was convenient to all the main attractions in the town, but was fortunately away from the heavy traffic area. It would have been nice if the resort had a restaurant and/or sports bar - but that is the only thing we found lacking. We were not interested in the shows and nightlight of Branson but were just looking for an inexpensive vacation close to outdoor activities - hiking, canoeing, amusement parks (Silver Dollar City). Overall, we had a very good experience and would recommend this resort to others visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Carol_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel spontaniously, we have enjoyed Sheraton in the past and this facility met all our expectation! The staff suggest a couple locally ran places to eat as well as makng reservations to a show and short cuts thru town. We reslly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BigMac1949
Reviews.Content: We're currently at the Lodge on a bonus week getaway and have thoroughly enjoyed our visit here, especially since it's not quite the season yet and occupancy is low, which means fewer kids in the pool and running up and down the hallways. This is not a premier Marriott property; it shows its age in a few places but our unit, as well as the rest of the facilities and grounds are very neat, clean and well maintained. Our 2-bedroom unit, in Bldg. 1, overlooks the shuffleboard area and main pool. It is a delightful view, with lush greenery and fragrant bushes and trees. We haven't taken advantage of any of the activities or amenities because we've been busy doing what we came here to do...see shows. This property is really quite nice. The front desk staff were professional, welcoming and friendly. They patiently answered my wife's questions. When our friends needed to print their boarding pass yesterday, it was done quickly for them. This is a place that we would definitely come back to on a getaway basis.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Willow Ridge”
Reviews.Author: garyv47
Reviews.Content: This Marriott property is not quite up to the standards of the other Marriott resorts. Though the rooms are fairly large, they are also quite dark and require lights to be on most of the time. Sound proofing between adjacent units is OK, BUT ALWAYS request a top level floor. We had a unit above us and there is little to no insulation between floors. Sounded like a herd of elephants above us. Resort amenities are limited, but do take advantage of the resort offered BBQ and sample entertainment, it was well worth $9.50 per person, a real deal. Wine and cheese party was also good, but get there early as the space allocated is not adequate for the size of the resort. If using the concierge, be sure to ask for Sharon. She is on top of the events and shows. The other person who works there did not give good advice and made faces when we told her we already booked some of the most popular Trip Advisor shows. She didn't agree and wanted us to go to some shows not so recommend. Glad we didn't take her advice. Overall, a nice resort and friendly staff, but not Marriott's best. Be sure to check out the Cosmopolitan Restaurant across the street. Very good food and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: winslow96
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Willow Ridge in Branson is the ideal place to stay. It is close to the strip but on a quieter street behiind the attractions. The lobby is beautiful and staff very friendly and helpful. On Monday evening they had a "Celebration" with a barbque dinner. They had 10 or so entertainers perform a song or 2 from their shows. This influenced us which shows to attend. Many guests attended their free wine and cheese reception that had entertainment. The pool was beautiful and there is a gym and rec room with a pool table and pingpong table. Restaurants are close without having to drive on the strip. ( Panera bread, Danna's barBQ, Lone Star and Florentina's Italian restaurant. Pizza Hut is within walking distance). We shared a 2 bedroom condo with close friends. We had 2 br, 2 bath, liviing room,kitchen,dining room,laundry facilities,balcony and 3 flat screen tv's.I can't say enough about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Whatcom
Reviews.Content: We are Marriott fans, but we chose the Willow Ridge Lodge based on Trip Advisor's rating. We were very pleased! The resort is close to all the activities, shows (and congestion) of Branson. Yet it is in a nice & quiet location which allowed us to sleep peacefully with the window open. Our unit had a very comfortable king bed with lots of pillows, a sofa and coffee table. The kitchen area was tiny, with a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, but no range or pots & pans. A small round table with two chairs sat in front of the window. The bathroom was spacious with a great shower. The fans and AC were whisper-quiet. Everything was spotlessly clean and in working order. There are many resort activies (movies, games, ice cream, etc.) geared to families, kids and teens. The huge outdoor pool was still closed in mid-April,but it was cool & breezy when we were there. A large indoor pool and gym are in the main building, next to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great place!”
Reviews.Author: davegidd
Reviews.Content: I originally intended to stay at the Hilton by Branson Landing, but it was damaged in the tornado and charging outrageous prices for what rooms they had left. So, I defaulted to my next preferred chain where I can get points, Marriott. I am so glad I ended up here instead of the Hilton! The location is just off the strip in a newer section along Green Mountain Drive. You'll need a car to get around Branson anyway, so being here wasn't a problem at all. Plus, there's no noise or traffic in this area. It is just a few blocks to the strip and the Presley theater is directly behind the property up the hill. Apparently this resort was supposed to be much larger, but they only completed three of the buildings. So, for the foreseeable future anyway, it isn't likely that any of the facilities will be overcrowded since they were built to handle ten buildings. The resort doesn't look unfinished, the grounds are beautiful and everything is impeccably maintained. The three 5-story "villa" buildings surround a pool, shuffleboard, and game areas. Tennis courts are on site also, plus a small wiffleball diamond. The outdoor pool wasn't open yet, which is odd because it was well over 85 degrees the whole week, but I guess that kind of weather is unusual since no other area hotels had outdoor pools open either. The staff at the front desk was outstanding. They were pleasant at check in/out, very helpful, and willing to provide whatever information needed. There is a concierge on duty to book shows and such during regular business hours. When I had a problem connecting to the free internet, the person I spoke with at the front desk went out of her way to help me even though it was AT&T's fault, not the hotel's. She even offered to let me use the computer in the lobby if I needed to get something important done. By the way, the internet problem wasn't resolved until the next day, but it wasn't the hotel's fault at all. When it worked, it was very fast. We had a one bedroom villa that was more like a private condo than a hotel room. I realize time shares are different than a hotel, but this place is very nice. The furniture was comfortable, as were the beds. The full kitchen was spotless and came with cleaning supplies, paper towels, etc. The washer/dryer in the room came in handy and worked out great. Hotel guests get free maid service every day just like you would in a regular hotel. They changed our towels daily and made the beds. The corridors are open air, which is odd for a place like Branson with such severe weather, but since it was warm during our stay, it was fine. The buildings have an elevator. Everything is very well maintained and looked almost new. As others have mentioned, you can hear people walking around above you, so hope that you get lucky and they aren't too loud. We were fine. We couldn't hear any other noises through the walls. There is no food service on the premises except snacks for sale in the shop by the front desk. I don't know if there are plans for a restaurant if the resort is eventually built out, but there should be. They had lots of scheduled activities during the day, plus several movies shown every night. I didn't participate in any of them, but if you are staying any length of time be assured there is something to do to entertain you and your children. I would definitely choose this property if I return to Branson. By the way, I got two phone calls to encourage me to come to the marketing desk. One right after we arrived to offer me a discount coupon book and a special deal on a stay at another Marriott Vacation Club. I declined and that was the end of it, no pressure at all. Right before check out I received a voice mail about the same issue, but that was it. I didn't feel it was unreasonable and the rep took no for an answer without any hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen T
Reviews.Content: Made my reservation online. Was pleasantly surprised upon arrival. Beautiful grounds. Well maintained buildings. Staff very friendly and helpful. Pools were not open but still plenty of activities for the whole family. Well worth the price. You will not be disappointed. My best advice - ask for a room that faces the pool area. The landscaping is beautiful. I would stay there again, only would ask for a pool view, building two or three and no higher than the third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break with kids”
Reviews.Author: TechnicianMichigan
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. Just the name of Marriott implies a really good timeshare location. Any little questionable repair item was fixed immediately. Even a wall clock. I have feather allergies and they swept the room clean before we got there. This is our first time in Branson. This was also the first week of the spring show season. We knew before hand that a tornado had gone through the town. What damage to some of the structures!!! The supermaket in town was destroyed by the storm. Shows were excellent. My granddaughters loved the Dixie Stampede. Go there hungry and bring your own knife and fork.

Reviews.Title: “Great timeshare in great location”
Reviews.Author: Looooove_2_travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week in teh Marriott in a 2 bed room lock out unit. It consisted of a large 1 bedroom unit with a full kitchen, with a small studio apartment next door that could be accessed directly from the large unit or via an external door. As others have described, the unit was kept very clean. The ammenities were very nice. Everything was top notch, with the exception of not having granite. The unit is located in a secluded area that is 5-10 minutes from all the theaters. Great location! It is a little tricky to find the first time since it is located off the road, but if you have a GPS and look for the Marriott sign, you will find it. My only negative comment about the resort is the same thing others said - you can hear noise from above. Everytime someone above me moved a chair, I could hear it very well. It is almost like they forgot to put insulation in the floors. Probably not good for light sleepers, but other than that, a fantastic location. Oh, almost forgot - the front desk is very helpful. We called ahead of time to see if we could check in early and they were happy to accommodate. When we arrived, check in was done in less than 3 minutes :)

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Willow Ridge”
Reviews.Author: BigBearLakeCabin
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. The desk staff was so helpful. We would stay here again. Loved the place. Carol

Reviews.Title: “Too rigid”
Reviews.Author: barrelracer82
Reviews.Content: While this is a nice hotel in a good location, we found them to be very inflexible and rigid. We were staying for our 10th anniversary. My husband asked to have flowers delivered before we arrived and they said they couldn't do that, it was against their policy. Then when we checked out we asked If they had a military discount and were told you have to request it when u book the room. I think next time we'll look for a hotel that is more accommodating and has better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent activity staff”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDreaming07
Reviews.Content: We have a Marriott time share and have stayed at many Marriott's. The activity staff here gave great advice and arranged nice activities including golf. The wine and cheese included a preview of a top rated show and included a displaced (due to Tornado) singer who did a great job. The room was nice but a little dated. The timeshare owners voted on no mid week cleaning nor fresh towels but a washer and dryer are included in larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great people”
Reviews.Author: fbraselton
Reviews.Content: we stayed at marriott's willow ridge vacation club in Branson March 16 - 20. The facility was very attractive and well kept and the staff very courteous. Wilma, at the conceirge desk, was extremely friendly, helpful and fun. she arranged all our show dates and tickets for us, gave us great information on such great resturants as Landry's, Billie Gails and sunday brunch at College of the Ozarks. Branson was fun and the stay at willow ridge made it even more so.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: enma
Reviews.Content: We are actually staying here at Marriott Willow Ridge right now. We came here for spring break as it is within a drive-able distance. Branson was not my first choice but we were able to get a week thru Interval so why not. I am here with my 15yr old son and his friend. What a pleasant surprise this resort is! I have traveled to several Marriott vacation club resorts as we are multi-week MVCI owners so I have high expectations. This is a "lower" level vacation club property but what it lacks in amenities it gains it in cleanliness. And the only thing it lacks from most other Marriott Vacation Club properties is granite counter tops. The resort is not too big so walking to the main building from any of the buildings is easy. My son and his friend have enjoyed playing basketball, swimming in the indoor pool (as the outdoor pool is not open yet), playing ping-pong and pool. I have used the exercise room and simply just relaxed sitting on the patio. The unit is very clean as I mentioned before. The beds are very comfy with luxury linens. The unit comes with a washer and dryer and fully equipped kitchen. The internet connection is free and fairly fast. Parking is easy. On Wednesday night they had a nice owners and guests reception with wine and snacks. Branson has kept my teenager son and his friend busy now for few days. Not sure when I will be returning here as Branson is not necessarily my type of town but when I come I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “almost 5 stars, except for comfort”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel69
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Branson Willow Lodge, however, I could not rest comfortably due to the extra firm mattress. (1 bedrrom suite, 2 adults) Pros: 1) Nice location 2) Very resonably priced considering all the resort offers 3) Limited activities, grills, nice swimming pool and snack items at front desk (pay) 4) Very clean 5) Very spacious 6) Well equipped wirth name brand appliances, refrigerator, kitchen, washer, dryer, pots, pans, utensils, coffee maker, diswasher, etc. 7) High quality bedding (albeit way too firm) 8) Easy access and convenient parking 9) Free full cable and all channels of HBO 10) 1 large and 1 small LCD televisions. 11) Nice balcony Cons: 1) Living area sofa and chair are very firm 2) Bed mattress is extra firm 3) Bed pillows are too soft for my liking 4) Water pressure is adequate,but not great 5) Floors resonate sounds (You will hear neighbors walking and the doors closing, and we stayed on the top floor) 6) No restaurant on premise (but many within short drive) SUMMARY: i really want to give this resort a 5 star rating, as the positives far outway any negatives. However, I woke up with my back hurting due to the frim mattress and my neck hurting due to no supoort from the bed pillow. If this is of no concern to you, then you will love this place. BRANSON TORNADO UPDATE: We stayed in Branson, 3 days after the March 2012 EF-2 tornado. Branson is doing a remakable job cleaning and restoring. All the roads are driveable and in excellent condition. The damage was restricted to a few venues. Don't let the tornado discourage your trip, since the impact is minimal and most venues are not affected.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Stay Here Everytime!”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorFinch
Reviews.Content: Excellent overall- friendly staff, attentive to our needs, spacious and clean rooms, comfortable beds, nice full kitchen, large patio. We stay here everytime we come to Branson which is a lot!!

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: Landonsdad
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice but the service was amazing. We had placed a contract on a house before we left home and when we arrived at the Marriott we had an email stating our offer was accepted and we had about 30 documents to print and sign, the front desk was so helpful they printed and scanned/faxed our documents so that we could relax on ur vacation. Way to go Willow Ridge

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: katydid1974
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at Willow Ridge Lodge the week of Thanksgiving. This was our first trip to Branson and our first stay as Marriott Vacation Club owners (this is a Vacation Club property). Even though the resort is in the middle of town, it is set back far enough from the hustle and bustle that you do not even hear traffic going by. It was wonderful! The grounds were beautiful and it was very relaxing. We stayed in a 2 bedroom unit that was actually a studio connected to a 1 bedroom. This was a great set up as our kids had their "own room" and we could close the connecting door if needed. The kitchen was well equipped; we cooked Thanksgiving dinner (turkey and everything!) and did not have a problem. There is a grocery store down the yellow route not far from the hotel that was a bit pricey but convenient to have close by. We did not make use of resort activities but the calendar looked like there were some fun things planned and the front desk staff and conceirge was exteremly helpful whenever we asked for assistance. They did not hesitate to make recommendations for food, activities or even driving routes! I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great outdoor activities”
Reviews.Author: lestep62704
Reviews.Content: The outdoor activities in the summer months are top notch. The pool area is beautiful and the staff coudn't be friendlier. You are so close to everything when staying here, but relaxing poolside you feel as if you are miles away from the busy Branson attractions.

Reviews.Title: “What at Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: I was at the Marriott Willow Ridge Resort in Branson, Missouri in November. This was a beautiful, clean and well kept resort, The front desk employees were very helpful even though I arrived at 8:00 at night and it was pouring rain. They offered to have someone help me with my luggage since I was traveling alone. The room was exception with one of the largest kitchens and living rooms I have seen in a long time. It looked like a condo in Colorado. I had a balcony with outdoor furniture and one bedroom with a king-sized bed. The bathroom was very spacious and had ample storage. There was even a washer/dryer unit right in the room. The only problem I had was not enough toilet paper in the room, but they responded to that problem quickly. There were interesting activities provided for quests as well as a movie on their wide-screen TV a the lodge every day for those who wanted to stay at the resort for the day. The lodge is located conveniently close to most activities. Would definitely stay here again the next time I am in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: digetydog2004
Reviews.Content: We have became owners of this property while it was being built several years ago. We just returned from staying here and being in the Branson area for some of the Christmas specials. As always, very friendly and helpful staff and large clean confortable rooms with full kitchen. This place is awesome! We highly recommend this property to anyone traveling to the Branson area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!!!”
Reviews.Author: bandit
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights! The property is nice. The condos are spacious and the bed was the best!! I am going to call back and ask about the mattress! Everything is convenient. Nice washer and dryer. I just can't say enough good things about this place. It is quiet - great balcony. Would definitely stay here again!!!! Definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable nice timeshare. I have stayed in plenty and this is the best. Pool and gym really nice. Clean comfortable. Delight”
Reviews.Author: sandyrct
Reviews.Content: See above. Great timeshare. Do not pass it up. Highly recommend. Great location. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: TexasBaskets
Reviews.Content: Great value with end of season rate. Grounds were spotless and every person we had contact with was professional and friendly and met our needs. Will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Branson, liked this place”
Reviews.Author: Christie M
Reviews.Content: We went to Branson between their busy seasons before and up to Labor Day weekend. Besides clean, spacious rooms and an in-unit laundry, it had great access to the shows, eateries, shopping on the strip. We enjoyed the outdoor pool, and the tours as well as daily/weekly activities scheduled at the lodge. The concierge was knowledgeable and helpful. No complaints at all about this place. Branson Creek and Ledgestone Golf courses were well worth playing. The Payne Stewart Course was also enjoyable if you are a super golfer. Breathtaking views at Branson Creek. Being our first time to Branson, we found this a great time of year to go as there was little to no traffic, waiting for eateries and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Rewards Points”
Reviews.Author: danielrstahl2003
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and courteous as Marriott staff usually are. The lodge was nice with a fireplace, table board games available, and DVD's available to be checked out and taken to one's room. We are not owners and will not choose to stay there again. We were there the week of Thanksgiving and totally regret that we used the Mariott Rewards points that we had been saving for vacation to stay here. We had to use two upgrades per night and the accomodations are similar to a Residence Inn! We asked to be moved to a top floor room because of the water noises, bathroom noises, and walking from the room above us. They offered a lot of actiivities it seemed. We were not able to take advantage of them. If it is summer time with the pools in operation and you have your kids with you, this is a great place for your family. While I used Rewards Points for our stay, I feel I "overpaid" for the stay. I still love Marriott Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room when guests above us were gone”
Reviews.Author: ah15022002
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many vacation club properties, but this was our first Marriott property. It was not as nice as others but was sufficient enough. My primary complaint is with the construction of the buildings. Where many hotels today are built with concrete floors/ceilings, this property is constructed with wood flooring. What that means is every run and jump is broadcast to the floor below. Unfortunately we had some very loud running children above us. (And yes, we have three kids, but we try to be very respectful of that issue in all hotels we stay in.) It was enough to wake our kids up from 10-11 pm. We called twice and the staff was very understanding and promised to call the guests, but it was a problem every single night. So, I guess it really becomes luck of the draw. All in all, the property as a whole is very nice and the kids partook of several resort activities. We would stay here again, and just hope no one loud was above us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property”
Reviews.Author: Hokiechip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights while visiting Branson and were very pleased with the property. Good location - close to all the attractions, but far enough off the main road (76) so you could easily get to your destination without battling the brunt of the traffic. Rooms was very nice and quiet. There were many guest events at the hotel although our schedule was fairly full so we didn't take advantage of them. Staff was very friendly. Will strongly consider staying here again on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Week”
Reviews.Author: peonyrose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in November at this lovely resort. I don't think we would stay any other place if we go back to Branson. It is rustic looking and we had the top floor-5- in building one and liked the location of the room and the resort. It is quiet yet you are very close to restaurants and the shows and Outlet Malls. The resort rooms and grounds are spotlessly clean. They have various and numerous activities all week catering to all ages. You really won't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: NurseKelli
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Willow Ridge lodge! We arrived not expecting what we saw. It was like an apartment complex! The front desk was SOOOO nice and helpful! We got to the room and we were shocked! It was so nice and clean!!! There was a sink, coffee maker, microwave, toaster, dishes and silverware plus much more that you can use to prepare a meal in your room! the bed was so comfortable! The linens were clean and soft. The bathroom was very clean and had everything we needed! the TV was awesome and there was a DVD player in the room too! We only stayed 2 nights but would be comfortable staying a longer time! they gave us a book with lots of stuff to do on the vacation grounds but we didn't have enough time to do anything extra! we will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Willow Lodge”
Reviews.Author: gardenias
Reviews.Content: Top notch, secluded, beautiful resort with lodge, and, exceptional grounds and pool. Very unique and private.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time Share -”
Reviews.Author: mini
Reviews.Content: We traded into the Branson Marriott WIllow Ridge. The time share is very nice; large kitchens;comfortable living room area; and nice bedrooms. We had a first floor room so easy to walk from the parking lot to our room. It was great having a washer-dryer in the unit. We enjoyed barbecuing here. It was nice that they both had gas barbecues; as well as charcoal barbecues. Both were high quality barbecues so it was great making meals. Market is about a mile away from the time share. Pool area and spa area is very nice; we enjoyed the areas. We also liked their club room and the seating areas there; the outside evening fire pit area was also nice. The Marriott Willow is close to the show areas in Branson. Since the lodging is not directly on a main road, it was quiet as well. (Note: You drive up a short hill from a main road to get to your lodging.). If you do not know the Branson area, be sure to watch for the street addresses and their one sign from the road to find the Marriott or you could easily drive past the entrance drive way. You will not see the buildings for the Marriott directly from the street like you do for most lodging in the Branson area. This is an excellent property and when we return to the Branson area and want to do the shows will stay here. If you want to focus mostly on lake front activities (boating, etc.), Indian Point is a better location for that. All in all, a wonderful time once we were checked in. The girl at the check in desk could have been a bit friendlier; but after we got through that; we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: donna C
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night in a one bedroom villa. Very clean, Surprisingly spacious with a full kitchen including washer/dryer. Balcony with a view of the Ozark mountains. Had a great fire at the firepit. Brought our own marshmellows, but when others forgot theirs, staff was very helpful and brought out smores AND hot chocolate. Watched a movie on the HUGE screen off the lobby and then did the indoor and outdoor hot tubs opened until midnight. Wished we could have stayed longer. Would definitely recommend. Try to take alternative routes from hotel maps as traffic was heavy on 76.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect...but pretty close!”
Reviews.Author: Jcshadoin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights, from October 10th thru the 14th and got a pretty good deal by booking several months in advance. Upon check in we were informed we had to put a 75$ hold on a credit card for in room purchases... Not a big deal but nobody mentioned that at the time of reservation. Our room was very clean and even better than the websites pictures. The only down side we discovered that night. Apparently the walls are very thin and we kept getting awakened by very loud footsteps upstairs ( we were on the third floor) and the sounds of toilet flushing etc. This went on at various times through our stay... And was definatley annoying at times. Also upon checking in we were told the gorgeous outdoor pool would be open until 5pm because temperatures would be warm enough. During our 2nd day it did rain in the morning so the hotel totally closed the pool for the day even though the rain moved out around noon and it was 80 degrees and sunny. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel (unless you are a light sleeper!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie54885
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend and loved it. Nice hotel with kitchenette. Friendly check in. Close to everything. We arrived early and the room was ready. They had ping pong table and pool table. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High quality and value”
Reviews.Author: texasmelted
Reviews.Content: We recently stay here for 5 nights and were very pleased. Our "1 bedroom" was small and only a single room with no separate living area, but nice, clean and well equipped with a microwave and refrigerator. The grounds are beautiful with 3 pools, one indoors, and an exercise room. You could rent popular, current DVDs in the lobby, which has a small shop with plenty of food. We were given a list of free things to do in Branson as well as information on shows and other activities when we checked in. The staff was friendly, knowledgable and helpful. The location is very convenient and we had no trouble with traffic, perhaps because of the time of year. The only mild criticism I had was the that the hallway of our unit was dismal, looked like a basement (we were in building 2, ground floor), which was very inconsistent with everything that was A+. We booked about 6 weeks early and the price was a real bargain. This place was busy and I expect it to become busier as people discover this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Branson. Nice kitchen and balcony. The grills are available outside for cooking burgers and hot dogs so that is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: stefani s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot Willow Ridge Lodge in late september during their Fall Spectacular sale. I am so glad that we had the opportunity to stay here. We have never stayed at a resort before ( well except for our honeymoon when we went to Vegas) and it was a delight to stay here. We stayed in one of the guest rooms and not an actual villa and although the room was a bit small, it was well laid out and the 9 ft ceiling made the room feel bigger. The bathroom also was a good size and had a long counter. This was great considering our stuff didn't take up the entire counter space like it did in other hotels. We were also glad that we had a small kitchenette that included a small fridge, microwave, sink and cabinets full of dishes, cups, silverware and even a toaster. Having the kitchenette really helped to save on food costs since we were able to buy some food for breakfast and lunches and only ate out for dinner. After we settled in our room we took a tour around the resort and loved how many family activities were offered. The resort offered basketball, tetherball, horshoes, a fire pit, bbq grills, shuffle board, craft activity room, an arcade, a small playset( slides only) and best of all the pools. We were delighted to see that the outdoor pools were still open even in late september because they were heated. They had three outdoor pools; one large, one kiddie and one hot tub/ spa. We took our daughter to the kiddie pool and since it was only 18 inches deep she could run and play all she wanted. She had such a wonderful time in the kiddie pool. Another feauture of the resort that we loved was the location. It was tucked away off of the main road ( green mountain) but was still close to all sorts of Branson attractions. We would love to stay here again in the future if we get the chance and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott resort”
Reviews.Author: sweet222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here some years back in a studio room. This time we chose the one bedroom villa. It was very spacious with full kitchen and balcony. The kitchen was fully stocked. We used the gas grill outside one day to bbq some hotdogs for lunch. The grounds are beautiful, pretty gardens and flowers, well layed out. I will mention a few things we were not pleased with. Personal preference but the beds and pillows were too soft. The shower pressure was barely adequate. The lighting seemed dim especially in the kitchen. We did not swim in the pool but one day I sat by the pool only to be driven away by the persistent loud volume of piped in music. Quite annoying, and for whose benefit? The pool was empty. Overall, it was a nice stay and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, and off the main drag”
Reviews.Author: cab3
Reviews.Content: My wife and her family celebrated their wedding anniversary and birthdays combined over Labor Day. We had adjacent four rooms on the 2nd floor of the 2XXX building. The entrance was on the second floor, but the patio out the back was on the ground floor, and very convenient to let the four kids with us play around right outside, but still within eyesight. The separate bedrooms made sleeping arrangements very nice. Our two daughters, ages 7 and 3, were able to each have their own room, while my wife and I were able to stay up later in the master bedroom without fear of TV keeping the kids awake. It was a bit hard to hear them that far away, but they seemed to manage. We'd definitely come back. The pools were nice, as were the activities for the kids, the cookout by the pool, and smores at night. We're already planning our next trip. I loved the Lodge, but really disliked the traffic of Branson, which somewhat detracts from the experience. The entire extended families had a great time, and we'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Johnna W
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great! Location, staff, service, pool, room. Couldn't have asked for more. We will stay here form now on whenever we are in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “housekeeping stole my laptop”
Reviews.Author: deb k
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel annually over Labor Day weekend. This year, after checking out, we realized we left our laptop in the bottom drawer. We immediately drove back. Housekeeping did not log finding it in the room and took it for themselves. I will not be back, and Marriot has lost its good name in our family.

Reviews.Title: “We will Be Coming Back!”
Reviews.Author: zoay
Reviews.Content: First time to Branson and we loved our stay at this Marriott! Our two bedroom was perfect for our family of five! loved the way the master bedroom was on the other side of the room away from the kids bedroom. they had there own bathroom and we had our own, shower was amazing with a huge seat, two heads and endless hard water pressure with HOT water. i miss that shower already! the bed and linens were so comfortable and i slept better than i do at home. laundry closet with washer and dryer in the room means i didnt bring home dirty laundry. full kitchen with dishwasher and nice dishes, pots/pans etc. grounds were very well kept with a beautiful water fall/ bridge going into the pool. everything so clean. both indoor and outdoor pools were too cold in 80 degree weather though. need to be heated more. only swam in pool ten mins before jumping in the hot tubs which were large and very nice with rock and nice landscaping throughout. even during labor day weekend this hotel was not overcrowded. we were able to easily grill outside and then eat at their picnic tables which we enjoyed. they have a great firepit and will light a fire for you if you ask. branson itself leaves something to be desired with its tourist trap ways, overpriced junk, green swampy type lake and horrible traffic so next time i think i would hang out even more around the hotel because that was the most relaxing fun part of the trip......thank you marriott! you won me again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: scoobski
Reviews.Content: Immaculate room, well-kept grounds, etc. Friendly staff. Noisy on the balcony due to the air conditioner (?), and the helicopter rides nearby. Not a good view-- it IS Branson afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Branson great!”
Reviews.Author: JeffersonCityAngid
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and clean, we loved the large living area that was separate from the bedroom (Made it lots easier with a toddler). Our room was close to the main pool, which was amazing. The staff made it fun with music, games, and you definitely felt like you were at a resort as opposed to a hotel. The location of the hotel was also great, it was right in the middle of town but yet quiet and secluded. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just like home, but better.”
Reviews.Author: DaveM2077
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay. This year we brought the whole family and booked two condos. One with the lock off for our two daughters and their families. My wife, sister and motherinlaw and I had one across the hall. Everyone had plenty of room and we can't say enough about the helpful staff. The outdoor gas grills were always clean. The pool excellent. A great place to stay-close to everything. About my only complaint was my iPad worked great in the kickoff, but sporatatic in the two bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “great relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: mutigerbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights this past week and had a great time. Its nice to have a washer/dryer in the room as well as a kitchen with everything we needed to cook in a couple of nights as eating out every meal gets expensive. Everyone was nice, polite and very helpful. We felt at home the entire time. Checkin was fast and easy, the pools were great and the place was really quite even though there were quite a few people over the weekend. This is the best place to stay in Branson. Another plus for us was that it was off the main strip as well as back off the road. It was very quite and we even saw a couple deer one night. We didn't feel rushed and the lanedscaping is very relazxing. Nicely done Willow Ridge for making me relax for a few days

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort & Immaculent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: moviegrrl3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 8/21-8/23 in a one bedroom villa. Room came fully loaded with full kitchen, two tv's, and a washer/dryer. I especially loved the washer/dryer. It's nice to pack light and then wash a load. They came in every day and made the bed (with no cleaning fee). The pools were beautiful. They have a nice sized child pool separate from the adult pool with sprinklers in it for the kids to enjoy. They also have a nice indoor pool as well. On Sunday they had s'mores by the campire (which was free) so we enjoyed a couple of yummy s'mores after enjoying the pool. Room was quiet and everything worked properly. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. We have stayed at a couple of Wyndam resorts in the area before, but this resort takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for what it offers; however, no restaurant or bar on site.”
Reviews.Author: rjflo2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for only two of our three nights in Branson. The property is great for those folks who want a full-size operational kitchen and room to house several folks. I should have researched the amenities more; but, with the words "Marriott" and "resort" in the same sentence, who knew!! There was no restaurant on site nor was there a bar/lounge. There were several pools and activities for all ages. We weren't looking for this style of property. It is excellent for those who are, however. It simply was not a fit for us; but, is a beautiful venue. The concierges were simply FANTASTIC!! Ours could not have been more helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !! Huge Pool...”
Reviews.Author: sergio c
Reviews.Content: Great facility, front desk & concierge(Kristilin & Sharon) were helpful..Marriott facility was nice and comfy Pool area was huge and roomy. Only downer and negative issues were the Pool bar, it had no mix drinks..beer and wine coolers only,,,. but the 2 bedroom units were nice. We are Marriott Vactaion Club Owners in Scottsdale , AZ. If you like Country Music and love live shows, this is the place for you. We happen to catch the worst temperature / heat & humidity of the week. 99*-109*. See "SIX" Great Show, top rated.. Golf courses were good,,, "TRAFFIC SUCKS TWO LANE ROAD IS TERRIBLE"..TAKES TOO LONG TO GET ANYWHERE !!! Best (2) places for dinner were Cantina Laredo Old downtown Branson and of course Landry's seafood on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Beth529
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from our 2nd visit to Marriott's Willow Ridge Lodge in Branson. The resort is beautiful, tropical and very well kept. We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom villas. Our grandchildren really enjoyed the evening campfire with s'mores and the Clubhouse where they could choose something to paint. The staff there is polite and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: MWilfin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights & really enjoyed our stay. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath villa. It is so close to everything but yet tucked away off the main drag. We will stay here again in the future. Nice pool with snack bar and we went to the indoor pool & hot tub when it rained one evening. The pillows were not too fluffy but that is minor. Other than that, it was perfect.
