Reviews.Title: “Was Almost Like a Hawaiian Vacation - minus the Hawaii part!”
Reviews.Author: Austen_gal
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here! A big bunch of my family stayed here for a weekend family reunion. My parents and aunt and uncle are Marriott time share owners, so they started it by booking these condos/villas. I didn't know what to expect and so I was floored when we opened the door and saw where we were staying. My parents had booked a studio room (Queen bed with couch/table area and kitchenette with attached bathroom) that connected to a one-bedroom suite (Queen bed with attached bathroom, full living room with couch and easy chairs, dining area and full kitchen). My sister and her 4 kids had the same set up down the hall. My Aunt and Uncle had a room with 2 bedrooms (a Queen with private bath and then one with 2 doubles, living room, dining area and full kitchen.) Was happily surprised to see the kitchen was equipped with most everything you'd need to cook and prepare meals (which we did). We took turns hosting meals for our large family over the days and we had tons of room for everyone. In all, in our two connecting rooms, we had 3 flat screen t.v's, and 2 bathrooms. I came without my family and for me, it was like having a luxury vacation with my super comfy bed and linens and all those fabulous pillows, my own tv, and bathroom attached. I really enjoyed it. Also, the bathtub was wonderful...very big and held a ton of piping hot water. The resort itself was amazing. They had everything you could want (books to borrow, a piano to play, self-serve popcorn machine, a little store for things you forgot) and need. I enjoyed their fitness room. The treadmill, elliptical and bikes all had tvs on them. I ran 5 miles just so I could finish my movie. They even had complimentary water and nice fluffy towels. The playroom/arcade looked fun for the kids, as well as the craft room. The indoor pool and spa didn't seem to get much use because the outdoor pool was amazing! Just like you see in Hawaii...it had varying grades and depths, a waterfall, a volleyball net and a splash area for kids. There was a hut hot tub that was shaped more like a kidney bean. In addition, there was another seprate kiddie pool that was 1 ft for the little ones. I thoroughly enjoyed myself out here...with my book and some sunscreen, I was happy for hours even in the heat. The snack bar had everything you might want (pool toys, sunscreen and food). I enjoyed the shaved ice ($5 for the souvenir cup and then $1 refills) immensely. There were a lot of activities (Free and some for fee) like movies, s'more roasting on a firepit, cannonball and pool games, Karoake, crafts for the kids, golf excursions, etc. When my cousin's daughter had her craft taken by mistake by another little girl, the staff not only refunded their money, they gave them all the supplies they would need to make another one so they could do it at home. Now, that's service! In addition to the free WiFi, the front desk staff generously allowed us to print some documents for our family reunion for free by giving us their email addresses and printing them in the office -- much appreciated. In all, I felt like I had a mini luxury vacation really (that might also be attributed to me being child-free for the first time in quite awhile), but I really did enjoy the entire thing. Don't hesitate to stay here...especially if you are with family and younger children.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the best in Branson”
Reviews.Author: arozylo1
Reviews.Content: I don't care what any other reviewer has said, but if you like a resort-like atmosphere with great pools, good service (including relible concierges), clean, modern multi-room suites in a park-like setting, come here. Most of other Branson accommodations are pretty tacky (albeit cheaper). The Hilton and the Radisson in Branson are OK, but they are hotels, not really resorts. We stayed in a fully equipped large, 2-bedroom unit (kitchen, living room, dining area, porch) that was clean, well-maintained and quiet. THe Marriott MVCIs we have stayed at are all top-notch, without exception. Try it, you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice for Branson!”
Reviews.Author: ostate1
Reviews.Content: With not too many nice places to stay in Branson, this is one we'll be back to! We stayed for 3 nights and could have stayed more. We were busy in Branson and wished we had time to just relax at this hotel for the day. We did cook dinner one night in the room. It's spacious, clean and the pool is tropical. Lots of activities for kids! Had a great time and the hotel staff was nice. We got it for a great price on Marriott.com...a special for Rewards members.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were at a beach resort not in the middle of Branson”
Reviews.Author: Kkgriff
Reviews.Content: I will definitely return to this resort. It is just off the strip on the yellow route, but you would think you had decided to go to Florida. It is very tranquel and nice. The pool is beautiful and inviting. The balconies are great overlooking the pool at night with its changing colors. The activities for the kids were wonderful including smore night. There is a movie that plays in a really cool room and if know one shows at the scheduled time you can choose another movie. We had a two room suite that was great for six. Nice to have a full fridge, stove, microwave. TV in all the rooms. Large table to sit around. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “wish we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: doddsy69
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights wish it had been 3 weeks its a great resort just off the main drag in branson my 12 year old son would move here full time he loved it lots of things to do organised or unorganised pool area was great we stayed in a one bedroom unit plenty of space and spotless as well . if we are back in the area we will be back here 100 per cent

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Kpodsednik
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay; great pool & lots of activities for the kids; would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: rmcdonald
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are Marriott time share owners at Grand Vista, a Florida property. A beautiful resort in Orlando close to all the activities central Florida has to offer. However, in most years we do tend to deposit our week just to see other parts of the world. We had not seriously considered Branson as a venue until last year when we decided to it was time for a family reunion trip. Branson, Mo. seemed to offer a good choice of activities for the entire family. I really didn't expect the Marriott Willow Ridge Resort to stack up well with other Marriot Time Share resorts but I was certainly wrong. It was the perfect choice for our family. I really believe if you never left The Marriott Willow Ridge Resort property you would have a great time in Branson. It is smaller than most other Marriott's we have been to. But, that takes nothing away from this property. It is very cozy and comfortable. You are less than a mile from the Branson "Strip" but you would never know. The experience feels very exclusive. The staff is courteous and attentive to every need. There are many activities planned and uplanned. I was a little disappointed in the pool bar prices but, that's Branson. Everything is overpriced. Also, there is no restaurant on the property. Not a problem though, there are many restaurants in the area. The suites are immaculately clean 2 bedroom 2 bath suites with fully stocked kitchen (not food) and living area. They offer big screen LCD TV's in the bedrooms and living are with DVD players. The bed and bedding is to die for. You will sleep like a baby. If you need anything, just call and your request will be fulfilled in minutes. I agree with many other posts about this resort. It is the best selection in the entire Branson area. Now, a little about Branson. The last time my family was in Branson was 1988. I am sorry to say that age has not improved the area. The entire experience is simply designed to suck dollars from your wallet...so be prepared. However, Silver Dollar City lives up to it's excellent reputation. It is well worth the time and mony we spent for admission. Check out the Branson visitor's center for the two for one ticket sale. You will get two days for the price of one versus what you will pay at the park. As for the rest of Branson, just drive on the "yellow" routes, avoid main street and keep you money in your wallet. As far as I can tell, few things are worth spending you money on in Branson, Mo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kmcdonald78
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with my parents, my kids, and my sisters' and their husbands and kids. We had 4 rooms in all, each in 2 adjoining rooms. While Branson offered plenty to do, the town itself was a dump and pretty expensive. Aside from Silver Dollar City (which was an excellent kid-friendly park, and you can get buy-one-get-one tickets at the Branson Tourism Center), we would have been perfectly happy staying at the resort all week. Every single member of the staff we interacted with was courteous, friendly, and helpful. Many of them went out of their way to help us get what we needed for our rooms, as well as to give us tips for getting around town or to prepare us for the different places we planned to visit. When we called to request towels, they called 5 minutes later to make sure we received them and to ask if we needed anything else. The cleaning staff greeted us with smiles in the hallway, and the maintenance staff did, as well. The outdoor pool was perfect for my little kids, and was great for the big kids, too. There were several hot tubs and an indoor pool, a game room to play pool & ping pong, and then board games you could check out and take back to your room. All Free. Then around the grounds there was shuffleboard, basketball, horseshoes, and probably other things I just didn't see. In addition to this, they were constantly having activities and games. I was a little disappointed that you had to pay for some of them, like ice cream at the pool, but oh well. Several nights there were s'mores at the fire pit, and then movies in one of the rec rooms- Kid movies & more grown up movies. We seriously could have been entertained at the resort all week. The grounds were well kept. There was plenty of parking and it was easy to navigate the resort. As we drove around Branson, I was grateful we were staying there, as almost everywhere else was really quite a dump. We went to the Amazing Pet Show since we thought that would be a good activity for our kids, but it was a huge waste of money. I am sure there are alot of good shows in town, but that is not one of them. Because of flooding earlier this year, alot of the hiking trails around Table Rock Lake are closed, as is Moonshine Beach, so that was disappointing. And Branson Landing suffered damage from that, as well. We spent the week sitting by the pool, cooking dinner in the kitchens in our rooms or on the free gas grills outside. There are also picnic tables outside you can use. The kids ran back and forth between the rooms, and the resort felt completely safe. The kids loved to go on walks around the resort and explore the many different sidewalks. The rooms all had TV's & DVD players. Free WIFI internet. The beds were extremely comfortable. Washers & Dryers right in your room so you can go home with all of your launry clean and ready to put away! The resort will lend you a high chair for free, if you need one. The shower even has 2 shower heads- one low one that you can use to give the little kids a bath = awesome. Ultimately, this was a great family vacation, and I highly recommend this resort if you are going to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort! Fabulous for kids!”
Reviews.Author: Mcwa
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this resort in Branson because we live in the Midwest and did not want to fly anywhere. It was more than we expected! Stayed in bldg 1 which overlooked the beautiful outdoor pool and firepit. It wS loud in the evenings, but very quiet after 10pm when the pool closed. Villa was beautiful! Very spacious and well-maintained. Our AC broke on a very hot day. It was fixed within minutes! Resort activities were great. Young children had a blast! Shows and activities in Branson are overpriced, but what you expect for a tourist town. Resort was close to everything, but set back away from the "strip". Resort concierge staff was not helpful at all. We asked both concierge staff members for restaurant recommendations, and they gave us the same restaurant three times even though they knew we'd been there already. Would return in a heartbeat! Very relaxing and well-maintained Marriott and we have been MVC members for many years!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and we're already planning our next visit.”
Reviews.Author: kiefjs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort with large, clean, tastefully decorated rooms and great, family-oriented activities, including multiple pools, game room, movie room, exercise faciilities, and plenty of planned events. The resort was so peaceful and quiet that it was hard to believe you were actually in Branson, even though the Strip was just a short distance away. In fact, Pirate's Cove is located adjacent to the property. So, it was just a short walk to be able to enjoy miniature golf and go-cart racing. The onsite facilities also include a wiffleball field, basketball hoops, shuffleboard, and horseshoes. Some of the events that were going on during our stay involved craft projects, a Wii game night, an ice cream social, a S'mores cookout, and a poker tournament. Our family had a great, relaxing stay for 5 nights and wished it could have been longer. We can't wait to come back. We would highly recommend the resort to all of our friends and family. Can't get much better than that.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected from a marriot.”
Reviews.Author: gonefishn42
Reviews.Content: we just expected more i guess. my room wasnt cleaned very good and there were stains on the sheets.thats to be expected from a super 8 or sleep inn but a marriot?

Reviews.Title: “Was I really in Branson?”
Reviews.Author: wtrvl
Reviews.Content: Thank God for this place - what a find! In the center of what is $50-$80 scum-dirty smelly rotten hotels (pretty much 98% of the Branson hotels) is this wonderful find. You would never know you were in Branson (thankfully). Great rooms, clean as a whistle, no stench, spotless beautiful grounds, staff that cares, activities for the children, and NO RIFF-RAFF! To the reviewer who wished they would allow pets, please no....go to one of the smelly hotels on the strip. I almost didn't want to write a review because I want this place to remain a secret. Keep the rates up so this place doesn't suffer the fate of the rest of the hotels in this town. Now when the kids want to go to SDC or White Water, I'll be fine with it, so long as I can stay at this oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Room, Great Pool, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: iBirddog
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Willow Ridge Lodge on several extended stays in Branson. The beautiful grounds, fantastic pool and many activities really give the place a resort feel. We have always stayed in the two bedroom villa which has a kitchen, balcony, laundry and two full bathrooms. The rooms are very high quality and are always exceptionally clean and comfortable. Our family of four has more than enough space to spread out. On our last trip I used the concierge to book some show tickets. She was able to save me nearly $50 bucks by calling the show and asking for the family rate. When we got to the ticket desk at the show there was no mention of the family rate so I am sure I would not have received the same deal had I made reservations my self.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: TNewby
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the March to May spring season. There are always lots of craft activities for youth and adults. This trip they had several excellent, recent movies (free) on their 10' by 14' screen which we watched. We chose to attend a timeshare upgrade points presentation - she laid out how it worked, then told us to get back to her within 45 days if we wanted it - a great change from other time share's hard sells. I Also love the indoor pool and hot tub, and the morning aerobics class. My only criticism is I wish they would explicitly set aside early morning (before AM) and after 8 PM adults only times in the pool, and would set aside a few rooms in one building where pets are allowed. While you are in Branson, the shows are great and reasonably priced (1/3 the cost of Vegas or New York), and the Red Roof outlet mall has great stores and prices!.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend for Families or larger groups.”
Reviews.Author: trmussel
Reviews.Content: This place is a must for a large family or a group. We have four kids(ages 14-7). They were content to swim in the outdoor pool all day. We brought noodles and rafts and they had a blast. Even Grandpa swam and he hasn't been in a pool for years. The rooms were very spacious with kitchenettes and a grocery store nearby, so you can prepare meals on site and avoid the crazy traffic!

Reviews.Title: “A vacation in itself!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkfishlady
Reviews.Content: Positive reviews on TripAdvisor led me to try out Marriot's Willow Ridge Lodge in Branson. It exceeded my expectations and we will definitely make this our new go-to spot for weekend getaways to visit Silver Dollar City. Our two kids (ages 3 & 4) LOVED the resort's pools--we could have stayed there for a few days and done nothing else in town and they would have been happy splashing in the kiddie pool fountains. The pools definitely set this property apart . The landscaping is beautiful , there are multiple hot tubs set apart from the rest of the pool area, and there is a snack bar, fountains, lots of chairs and lounger space, etc.--all things that set the pool area apart from a "regular" hotel pool. As a mom of little ones, I appreciated that they had a lifeguard, zero-entry pools, and depths as shallow as 1.5'--my little kids were able to enjoy a pool space separate from the "big" kids and it was great. There were a lot of people enjoying the pool area, but it was large enough that it never felt really crowded. The main building of the Lodge also offered movies, arts & crafts, planned activities (we were there on Smores night!), and a small playground--it's definitely family friendly. We stayed in one of the guest rooms that offers a kitchenette, a sleeper sofa (which was fine for our kids, but would have been uncomfortable for a teen/adult), and a queen bed and it was perfect for our family of four for a couple of nights. The kitchenette included the basics for a few easy meals eaten in the room (the table was actually set when we arrived, a nice touch!), and the room was not big but it was comfortable. For a longer stay (or for a bigger group or older kids) I would recommend getting adjoining rooms or one of the villas for added space (and the villas are nice because they have a balcony and a washer/dryer). I booked just a day before traveling, and I wasn't able to book via a TripAdvisor link because the discount websites said there was not availability. The Lodge's direct website, however, did have availability and a web discount that turned out to be a great value considering how nice the property was. This is a Marriot timeshare property, but no one tried to sell us anything and it just felt like a nice hotel experience. I would definitely recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: tdiddyclan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last summer with family (3 young children) and it was a great experience. Room was spotless and with very nice furnishings, well laid out and roomy. The pool at the lodge is very nice, the kids really enjoyed it. Only issue was a bunch of small kids staying on the floor above us running and jumping did make a lot of noise, but that was not the hotel's fault. If that bothers you, book a top floor room. Also the location of this lodge is off the main drag so it is quiet and not so busy. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tex1939
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice place to stay. Very quiet and close to all the theatres. It was very spacious - like a small apartment. We are looking forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to move right in and stay a while.”
Reviews.Author: RayLorraine
Reviews.Content: Willow Ridge was VERY comfortable, clean and quiet. Everyone was willing to help with whatever was needed, whether it was for an extra towel or directions to an attraction. It is located very close to all attractions on 'the strip' and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and vey comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jpcruizer77
Reviews.Content: Stayed the first week of April, Branson is just waking up. The Lodge is centrally located, excellent room, we had a 2 bedroom suite. Very comfortable beds, updated decor with 3 large flat screen TVs and stackable washer/dryer in unit. Kitchen had everything we needed including all the cleaning supplies. The staff was wonderful and very helpful, as first time visitors we took the area overview tour which we recommend. Lots of family oriented activities on site too. The jacuzzi has one strong jet at the end with lots of regular ones too, which we greatly appreciated after walking the surrounding hills. The lodge booked us tickets to some great shows and recommended fantastic restaurants, don't miss Landrays and College of the Ozarks. They really took great care of us and made for a very relaxing yet fully entertained week. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Villa”
Reviews.Author: netraveleromaha
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. We stayed in a one-bedroom villa. I'm sure they try to sell you a timeshare but I just said not interested and they didn't push it. The villas have a stackable washer/dryer, full kitchen with dishes, dishwasher and plenty of counter space. Everything in the room was extremely nice, clean and well kept. Bed was very comfortable and a ceiling fan in the bedroom. Says there is no daily maid service unless you request it and pay extra. We were there 4 days and the 3rd day they came in and cleaned at no charge. Overall I would highly recommend staying here if you have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: WDMTraveler
Reviews.Content: I will echo all the previous reviews on the Marriott Willow Ridge Lodge.This is a great resort and the staff is wonderful! My husband and I stayed in a 2 bedroom villa. It was very spaciousand very well appointed. The unit had a full kitchen and was very well stocked with dishes and cooking utensils. Our villa overlooked the pool area and would be a particularly desirable unit in the summertime. The staff at the resort were about as friendly and accomodating as I ever seen. They had numerous activities throughout the week and everyone was so friendly and made our time therevery enjoyable. Thanks to the Willow Ridge Lodge for an enjoyable time in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: julie129
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotels that I have stayed at. I brought my two young children with me to this hotel. When we arrived they were very polite and welcoming. Fast service and they helped with any need that we may have had. IT was very nice, clean, nothing wrong a perfect stay and a perfect hotel.my children enjoyed the hotel and they loved the pool. they had great room service. i remember one night we need extra sheets and pillow due to our son got sick and they came up and changed and cleaned up right away and were very nice about it keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: arkansasutesfan
Reviews.Content: I have owned at this resort since it opened. It is absolutely wonderful. The rooms are clean. The beds are extremely comfortable. The accommodations are perfect. The service is great. We have stayed here at least 10 times in the past few years and have had the same experience every time. Highly recommend as the best timeshare in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy w/a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyHomeStager
Reviews.Content: Based on the pics of the resort you'd think this is in the the woods. In reality it is only 1 bloc from the main strip -76. They did a nice job orienting the property in a way that it sits back away from the noise but is close to everything Branson. We were there in Nov so the outdoor activities were closed down. They have coffee in the AM and various activities for sign up, some at nominal cost. The room was perfect. We had a studio with a kitchenette. The bed was comfortable and the feather pillows soft. I'd stay again w/o hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cab1960
Reviews.Content: Three couples stayed at Willow Ridge for 4 nights. It was wonderful. Outside pool was excellent (closes at end of Sept.). Our 2 bedroom villa was clean, spacious, and up-to-date. Staff was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay! Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: brew_crew122
Reviews.Content: Ended up here after a horrible experience at the Holiday Inn around the corner. This hotel exceeded our expectations, and I am now a Marriot rewards member after 20 year as a "priority member" with Holiday Inn. Everything about the Marriot was what we were looking for. Only downside was no breakfast area, but there are many good places to eat nearby (Starvin Marvins was excellent) Will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and will return”
Reviews.Author: 22Debbie
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel/resort to be everything we could want for our stay in Branson, MO the week of 9-14 to 9-18. Staff very helpful from the desk clerk, the concierge & housekeeping. Would highly recommend to anyone. There are many attributes to staying here that make it a A+++ in Branson. Location to start. Provided easy access to anywhere and the ability to drive around the "Strip". Has a large pool area and gas grills for those times when you don't want to eat out. Price was very reasonable and excellant for the value in the 1 bedroom villa. Clean!!! Everything in the kitchen we could have needed. We did prepare meals and ate dinner and breakfast on the balcony which seated 4 people. When we make our next trip to Branson this will be our first choice for accomodations! You wont regret making this your home away from home!!

Reviews.Title: “very veyr nice time share”
Reviews.Author: brothermikegoestenko
Reviews.Content: i went widow ridge with my mom my aunt and two of there friends hear a lot good things about this resort and my mom i love her to pieces but can get fussy sometime but we all like the restore they have very friendly people who work there was planter actives and the pools where nice they took care of the ground work and the room where very clean the one things i also like at this place wean there is problem they fix right away and hounst about what was wrong with it we 4 lady and all them where please about place and i think they did there job i had no problem at all i give them a perforce 10 and the only other Marriott hotel i give them a 10 is residence inn in north little rock so my advice is anyone who stay hear will not be disposition

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Labor Day Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BAC1969
Reviews.Content: Overall, great stay. Had a 2 bedroom villa that was clean and well appointed... typical of Marriott Vacation Club. Overall staff was friendly, especially the Front Desk Supervisor, who checked us in and out. I think her name was Heather Marriott. Pool and grounds were nice. Only negative was our view of parking lot from balcony. We are Marriott vacation club owners and hoped to have a view of the pool and grounds.... other than that, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place.”
Reviews.Author: jackieEdgewoodKy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Branson. We were three couples traveling together. Each couple had a one bedroom which had plenty of room. Everything was very clean and comfortable. The rooms had everything needed for a wonderful stay. Every employee we came in contact with was extremely nice and helpful. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accommodations, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: autumnsonata
Reviews.Content: Five of us were in Branson for a bachelorette party and we rented a suite, which turned out to be two adjoining rooms. There was enough room to hang out, drink a a little champagne, and catch some z's. This place is set up like an apartment complex, with the doors opening onto an outdoor breezeway. The decor is not what I would call tasteful (who mixes beige and gold in a bathroom??) and it had a kind of country decor with twig sculptures on the walls. But, it served its purpose, and it was nice and quiet, which is what you want when you need to get some sleep. Wi-fi worked only some of the time, which was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in the center of all the action”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Georgian
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights after a family reunion at the Willow Ridge. Booked it online through the Marriott website and got a special deal for Marriott Rewards members which made it reasonably reasonable. It's a timeshare property but they also rent rooms like a hotel. We had a 2-bedroom suite on the 4th floor in Unit 2. One bedroom had 2 queens (great for the teenagers) and its own bath, and the other had a king with bath (shower, no tub in that one). It had a nice living area with a balcony overlooking the pools and a full kitchen -- very comfortable! The property has several pools of various sizes in a complex in the center of all the buildings. They're beautifully landscaped and very well kept. There's also a workout room (mostly cardio equipment), ping pong tables, pool tables, etc. Outside, there's a shuffleboard court, basketball courts, tetherball and fire pit. They offer a full program of activities (wine and cheese receptions, movie showings, city tours, Branson show previews, s'more making...) most offered for a small fee ($5-$10 per person). We didn't get to take advantage of any of them because we were only there a short time and devoted most of our time to seeing shows, but were impressed by the variety of offerings. We would definitely stay here again if we got a similar deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/resort for families...”
Reviews.Author: Kym T
Reviews.Content: This resort was everything promised..friendly staff, wonderful activities for children, great pool, located off the Branson "strip" which is exactly what we wanted. (not so much traffic) There were many activites scheduled daily ( with very reasonable prices). Would go back again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Value”
Reviews.Author: MelissaD20
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my adult daughter on a Mother/daughter trip and splurge on just us. I chose this property as we are Gold Club Members and usually the value is comparable to others. The room was tiny, no upgrades are available and the view was of the parking lot away from the amenities. I took one look around and left...unfortunately we went to the Residence Inn, which although the rooms were larger, the pool/hot tub hadn't been cleaned in some time. We cut our trip short and went to KC!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and activities”
Reviews.Author: lestep62704
Reviews.Content: The staff is top notch and the activities are first rate. We enjoyed every minute at the resort and you truly wouldn't have to leave for the entire week with everything they have available to do from big screen movies to Get To Know Branson tours. The outdoor pool is huge and they have 2 outdoor hot tubs open until midnight for a little private relaxing time away from the kids. They also have an indoor pool and hot tub available and a large indoor activities area. Spacious accomodations and a friendly and helpful staff make every visit we have made there memorable.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a rare gem in Branson!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rockhead2010
Reviews.Content: We can't wait to go back to Branson, just to stay here! Amid all the cookie cutter hotels, this place was like an oasis in the desert! From the moment we drove onto the property, we were impressed with every aspect: the grounds, the staff, the room, the pool, the amenities. We had one problem with our room, and within 15 minutes of calling maintenance, they were there and did not let up until the problem was resolved, which included a different staff member coming the following today to ensure the problem was fixed. Marriott does everything top notch, we have found, but they have gone over and above with this property!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than our best expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily05
Reviews.Content: Finally, a nice, renovated, clean, quiet, spacious place to stay on vacation! This resort exceeded our expectations: our 2 bedroom villa had plenty of space for our family and a week's worth of luggage, groceries, pool toys and other misc items; it was like new and very clean - I wasn't worried about letting our toddler roll around and play; the resort had plenty of activities if needed; rooms blocked outside noises; great location near strip but away from all of the congestion thanks to it's location on the back road... about 10 mins from everything! We will stay here again! Having a great place to stay really helps the family enjoy vacation!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but don't try to sleep late”
Reviews.Author: sbrtdkkmom
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful, well-built and very centrally located. Quiet at night and afternoon, but apparently a family destination. The children near us got up before 8 on Sunday morning, then the housekeeping carts started rolling around 8:45. We were there for a romantic weekend to celebrate our anniversary and had been out late at a concert Saturday night, planning to sleep in Sunday! If I were not planning to sleep in I would definitely stay here again as it is a beautiful place and very nice facilities. I also will consider asking them if they have a quieter building.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: leo1976
Reviews.Content: The resort speaks for itself but the staff to go with it isn't always easy to find. This one has it all. Great staff and all around good choice when in Branson. I highly recommend the trip to Eureka Springs Arkansas. Its a 53 mile journey but worth the ride.

Reviews.Title: “Hands Down - Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: cajunprincez
Reviews.Content: Where to start? This place is convenient to everything! Shopping, shows, grocery stores, gas station, downtown is a straight shot up 76! We arrived around 9:30 that night, tired as all get out and we were greeted by the friendliest clerk who gave us an activities schedule, menus and maps. Unloading was not a problem because each building has luggage carts and elevators. We got groceries and cooked in the unit most days, but the resort offered a lunch special every day. On Monday, we did the Wii bowling tournament and there was Texas Hold'em that evening, but I was a few minutes late. (Please get there on time, because the activiites fill up fast!) Tuesday, we spent the entire day on the property including the Complimentary Mary Kay Makeovers, the "Get to know Branson" tour, the Stone Hill winery tour and Blackjack later that evening. Wednesday was awesome and the Wine and Cheese social is not to be missed. There are a ton of things to do, even if you do not feel like going off the property. As a mother of a toddler, they made it extremely easy by providing a pack and play and a booster seat for my 14 month old. The kiddle pool and entire pool area was great too! I recommend you wear goggles if you plan on swimming underwater though, the chlorine was STRONG! The beds slept pretty well, although they were s little too soft for my liking. I had a great time lounging in the living room in the oversized chair and ottoman. Also, as a plus size woman, I enjoyed the oversized tub, which provided space for me and my toddler to bathe and have bath-time fun! Well, we had to leave eventually and check out was a breeze! They even sent me a copy via email, which I got this morning. When we got home, my BFF realized she had left her bag with her house and car keys at the Lodge. We live in Jackson and that's a 9 hour trip. We called the Lodge and told them about it. They shipped is to her overnight at no cost and we are happy to report she is now at home, in her own vehicle. So, if you're looking for a place to stay, at a great price, with people who will go the extra mile to make you feel good, this is the place. And yes, yes, yes, yes, yes... I would recommend this hotel to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for the kids”
Reviews.Author: carverfam
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Branson with Grandmother, Aunt, teenage niece and my two younger children. We wanted accomodations for everyone in one unit and this beautiful condo did not disappoint. Two days we never left the property...the kids enjoyed the scheduled events such as relay games and arts/crafts. The pool area is beautiful, there is a sport court for basketball and in the evening we had smores. The kitchen had everything we needed, but the location is convenient to restaurants and shopping. After this trip, we will not stay any other place in Branson. Truly, from the nice furnishings to the welcome center with games, etc. to check out, this property has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: thatmommygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I are so glad we chose the Willow Ridge Lodge to spend a romantic night away. We both loved it. The staff was very friendly & the guest room clean and comfortable. We will be going back with the kids. I know they will love the pool & extra activities offered.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place. Would go back”
Reviews.Author: texasmom1
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice vacation resort right in downtown Branson. The room are clean and roomy. The pool and two large spa's are lovely. The propery has plently of parking for people that are pulling boats etc. Check is staff was genuin and friendly and helpfull with any question. We had a top floor unit so I don't know how noise levels under others is.

Reviews.Title: “You will not regret it”
Reviews.Author: keatingfamily
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience in this resort Thanksgiving week 2009. The unit we had was a 2BR/2Ba we got through an Interval International exchange and I would have paid $175-200/night for it if I had to pay cash. The location isn't perfect for Silver Dollar City, but we managed it just fine. It's off 76 so you don't have all the insane traffic, but it is still busy. We really enjoyed many of the activities onsite including the smores reception and the Monday evening show across the street. They invite in some of the less known acts from town and feed you a buffet dinner for $9.50 (kids 6.50). It was money well spent. Almost all the acts were very good and the food was far better than I expected. My wife got a free Mary Kay makeover which is obviously there to sell product but she found to be full of good advice as well. Office/concierge staff is outstanding, especially Inis. We are already looking to return to the resort in a different season to experience it in a different way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: luvmythree
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the buildings and beautiful grounds. Everything looked extremely new and was absolutely spotless. My children are only 4 and cannot swim yet, but the indoor kiddie pool was perfect for them--it was warm and large enough to keep them entertained for over an hour. The people at the desk were very friendly at check-in, but at check out on the morning of Nov. 22nd, they were extremely rude. I loved our room, but must admit that it had the most uncomfortable bed my husband and I have ever slept on. My parents stayed there at the same time and were satisfied with their bed though. My husband suggested that ours was just broken down, because it was more than just a personal preference. This was my first trip to Branson so I was concerned about location; however, the location is absolutely perfect--you can see the main strip, but are not on it and you can easily access the back roads around Branson to avoid the unbelievable traffic on 76. It was also very close to Mickie D's, which was convenient for our little ones. The hotel sits rather far from the road, but at the entrance there is a very nice Pirate Putt Putt golf that totally captivated my kids. It would be an easy walk from the hotel, as would several little shops and restaurants. Overall, I would recommend this hotel , but would request another room if I were to stay again and had an uncomfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and very accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: thetraveler002
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, having reserved three nights. Got there a day early and were accommodated without any problem. Great rate on line with Marriott, discounted leisure rate. King suite on 5th floor, with balcony and full kitchen, as well as living room and seperate bedroom. Even had washer and dryer in suite. Close to all but not on busy main street. Staff very helpful. Enjoyed wine and cheese night with other guests and ice cream night was fun. Will have to return.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than A Run Of The Mill Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: It's off the main drag, but not too far. We rented a room with a queen bed and sofa. My wife thought the room was much better than a typical hotel room, but I personally couldn't tell much difference. The room had a microwave, small frig, and full size coffee maker, which was very nice. The hot water left a little to be desired for shaving, and the water pressure for the shower was lacking. Lakes are everywhere so I don't know why they couldn't heat the water more and provide a stronger stream of water for the shower. The view wasn't much, just an empty lot with the usual growth in it. We went to see the leaves turning, not to see Branson, so we can't help you much with Branson activities. However, the traffic in Branson is TERRIBLE. Stay outside of Branson and just go there for the attractions would probably be the best bet. There was a giant pool at the Marriott. I'm sure there were lots of things to do there, but we just spent the one night. The queen bed was very comfortable, and they provided extra pillows as we requested.

Reviews.Title: “Branson in the Fall”
Reviews.Author: JayB25
Reviews.Content: The facility is first rate. It is convenient to all Branson activities. They provide a preview show with approx. 10 acts including dinner for $8 per person. Most folks end up booking at least one of the shows as the performers are excellent. The concierges are a great help - they have a list of the 100+ shows and book them quickly. if you want to do Branson - this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: MissouriGrannie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this facility multiple times and I have never been disappointed for any reason. Our room has always been extremely clean and the staff always strive to make our stay pleasant. Our most recent stay, Kristie checked us in and went above and beyond to accommodate us and assure that we had everything we needed to make our stay the best. Any time we go to Branson, we stay here for these reasons. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: jsatter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The kids loved the huge outdoor pool. Was easy to get anywhere from here. We usually stay at cabins by the lake but I have never found one that I love. We will never stay anywhere else again!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Luxury in the Heart of Branson”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: Attempted to check into Horizons by Marriott at 2pm. We are not timeshare owners, but had found Horizons online. 1 bedroom suite for $129 per night. They told us it would be another :30-:45 minutes before the room was ready. Now, I had requested through reservations a 12pm checkin, so I was a little dismayed -- lousy first impression. We decided to walk the property for a bit while we waited. The check-in area was very nice with a "den" for watching movies, free popcorn, movie rentals, etc. downstairs there was a gameroom with boardgames that could be checked out, pingpong, pool table, video games, etc. There was also a childrens craft area that was scheduled for kids activities throughout the weekend. Outside the pool theming is spectacular. There are two garden paths that zig-zag down the hill through landscaped gardening along a waterfall that spills into the pool. There is a very large hot-tub, and a childrens pool (1.6 feet). The childrens pool has no lifeguard, but does have zero depth entry on one side. The main pool is free form with zero depth entry on one side. A poolside cabana has snacks and pool toy rental. Our room is just spectacular -- nicest hotel room i've ever been in. When you walk in, on the left side is a pantry with washer/dryer combo. Full kitchen straight ahead. Dining room with seats for six. They pulled out the couch and had it made up as a bed for our 3 year old. Nice big LCD tv/DVD in the living room and a HUGE deck overlooking Green Mountain Dr. The bathroom only has one sink, but is otherwise well equipped. Nice big shower/bath with the curved shower rod. Bedroom has another LCD TV and a big fluffy bed with dozens of pillows on a pillow-top mattress with high thread count sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience, we were thrilled!”
Reviews.Author: Calanna
Reviews.Content: We had a two-bedroom, two-bath villa with living room, dining room, fully-furnished kitchen (fridge, microwave, stove, oven, dishwasher, blender, toaster, and coffee maker), plus an in-room washer/dryer. The rooms were spacious, immaculate, and nicely decorated. One bedroom had a king-size bed with closet, TV, shower, sink, toilet, and hair dryer. The shower had both a standing and seated option with separate adjustable nozzles. The other bedroom had two queen beds with closet, TV, bathtub, sink, toilet, and hair dryer. The beds were so incredibly comfortable it was hard to get up in the morning! Tons of closet/drawer space were appreciated, as well as the ample supply of beach towels. The living room had a pull-out sofa, lounge chair, and large flat screen TV. Dining area had a large table with six chairs. Everything was provided, and in quantities so generous that we never requested maid service or needed restocking our whole stay (Monday through Friday). The location was great -- close enough to everything but nestled away in a beautiful and quiet location. The kids loved the large outdoor pool and hot tub (and indoor pool was also available), plus the game room with free ping pong, pool, foosball, and board games. Outdoors were also shuffleboard and horseshoes. Oh, and a free movie on a big screen every night. Only complaints -- the wireless internet service was very spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, comfy, lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: professorroyhinkley
Reviews.Content: This was a big surprise for us. The rooms were really comfortable (kind of a weird room layout, with the bed next to the door)... The bed was awesome - one of the best hotel beds ever. There seemed to be lots of room to move around and set luggage all around. I'm not sure if the room was actually bigger than usual, but it seemed like it. The workout room was excellent, and with pool / ping pong / etc. right outside, it was neat to workout then shoot a quick game of pool. [No free breakfast, by the way... and an early checkout time] The staff was super friendly. Didn't use the pool, but it looked excellent - really large and fun. The rate was excellent (gov't rate) for the room. I saw an earlier review that said it was loud, and the doors slammed. I guess they did, but we didn't hear the kids outside - certainly no more than any other hotel. We found it to be pretty quiet. The grounds around the buildings were really nice as well - made for a nice early morning walk! This property is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location ... nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kim_Plautz
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel over 4th of July weekend. There were some surprises, both good and bad. The way the hotel is set up, the regular hotel rooms are put in-between the suites. So, if you want a quiet getaway for two, you will probably be living next to a family of four. The doors slam loudly and conversations carry in the halls, so it won't be a quiet stay. On the plus side, there are tons of activities on-site and nearby so you won't be in your room very much anyway! The concierge Wilma was great - even got us 2nd row tickets to one of the shows! It is walking distance to several restaurants and mini-golf. Daily cleaning is optional, but there is a charge if you want your room cleaned during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kansasgal80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night and were very impressed by everything and the staff. We even got to check in 3 hours early! The rooms was really clean and big, we stayed in a guesthouse room, the pools were nice and large...couldnt ask for better! We will only stay here for future visits! The resort sits off the yellow highway next to Pirates Cove tucked back so its a perfect location near the strip but far away its quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: disc0untdiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this family-style condo resort with another family with a young child and we all felt it was well worth the money. We had accomodations for six which included a suite that had one room with a queen bed and pull-out sofa, a room with a king bed, a sitting area with pull-out sofa, full kitchen and dining area. The at $150/night (with military discount) we spent less on the room for one night there than we would have paid at a hotel, and we saved money by cooking meals rather than eating out (not to mention the privacy of seperate rooms). The staff was great and the pools were incredible. Honestly, we could have spent an entire day just hanging out by the pool and barbequing with other families. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best of Branson ... we loved our Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kchcool
Reviews.Content: Room was fabulous. We are Marriott timeshare owners. This is a great one. Extremely comfortable, kitchen had everything... serving dishes & CORKSCREW! The beds are the best beds of any hotel/motel ... Marriott beds are almost as good as sleeping at sea! We loved having the newspaper at the door each morning. It really was like being at home! If we ever came back to Branson again, we would only stay at the MARRIOTT HORIZONS!

Reviews.Title: “Branson's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: sara-b-bara
Reviews.Content: We went for a girl's weekend and stayed one night in a two-bedroom villa. We were on the fifth floor with a great view of the pools. The room was amazing. I have been to Branson about 100 times and have never stayed in a nicer room. The thing that I liked most about it was that you only had to stay one night. There are many resorts around Branson, but most have to be rented for at least 2 nights. It is very conveniently located. We never had to drive more than 10 minutes to get anywhere. I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: 1finesoup
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Branson on May 3 after spending a week in a 2 bedroom unit with a lockout. We were on the fifth (top) floor of building 2. I had called Horizons in advance to request a top floor unit and was told they couldn't assign it until we were there in person. When we arrived, they had our request on file and were able to accommodate us. You can rent movies for $1.99 at the front desk which came in handy on some very rainy evenings. We were very happy we had taken umbrellas because it rained every day (springtime in the Ozarks). The condo was absolutely spotless thanks to our Irish housekeeper (I wish I had gotten her name). The following items were provided in our units and might be helpful to know: 2 packages of coffee along with extra filters, 2 rolls of paper towels, dish soap and dishwasher soap, bath soap, 1 individual box of Tide for the washing machine, a daily USA Today paper . The bathrooms have hair driers, the kitchen provides dishes for 4 as does the lockout bedroom kitchenette. There is a ceiling fan over the bed which is lovely for those of us who don't like a/c. The covered balcony is very nice with seating for 4. While the property has a very mini market next to the front desk, there is a Jubilee grocery store in the same strip as the Walmart and they are 5 minutes away. We compared the prices of pop, beer and wine and found the Jubilee to be less expensive for our choice of pop and beer. The Walmart is not a large one and doesn't offer any produce, deli, etc. (They do have great pizzas, though). FYI, there is a big Walmart north of town that you can see from the highway as you drive south from Springfield. The Horizons is on the yellow route which is helpful to be able to avoid the extremely heavy traffic on 76. A nice excursion was a trip to Eureka Springs, AR which is about 1 1/4 hours away. A pretty drive and a pretty town. There is a huge variety of entertainment in Branson. It's not just for fans of country/western music. We were delighted with the shows we saw.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvl65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Horizon from 4/9-4/12/09. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially when we had some car issues , Holly, Rachel and Krista to the rescue. The Facility is fantastic, so comfortable you just feel like your home or wish it was home. The bedding was very comfortable made for an excellent nights sleep. We had teenage boys and they enjoyed the pool and weight room, plus having their own space with their own TV and bathroom, we all had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “More like home than a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: twincitygal
Reviews.Content: We were in Branson on Spring Break. Typically we stay at Marriott Residence Inn. Because I booked late RI was full so we ended up booking at Horizons. My procrastination really paid off! This is a beautiful property. We stayed in a one room condo which had a nice size kitchen, living/dining room, large bedroom and bath. Our unit even had a washer & dryer. The grounds are beautiful and the staff was also great. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSix
Reviews.Content: Our family of five loved this property. The rooms were very spacious and nice. We stayed in a two bedroom villa. It was just perfect for a larger group and very nicely decorated and maintained. The room would have fit 8 people pretty comfortably. The two bathrooms were great too. We loved all the immenities but the best was the Monday morning tour of Branson with Debbie, the recreation director at the resort. She drove us all around town and gave us some great tips of places to eat and entertainment options. It was well worth the small fee. We loved the firepit (although it was under construction the last two nights), the shuffleboard, basketball court, gas grills, ice cream social and our son enjoyed "teen night". This is only a small list of the activities the resort offers. The indoor pool area was really nice and the water was very warm! The location is convenient on the "yellow route" and was centrally located. Overall, a very delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureGirl442
Reviews.Content: This was a family trip and the hotel was wonderful. The staff was very nice and the activities really set this hotel apart from the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Quiet Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: XNAGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom villa. It was really spacious, especially the kitchen area. The bed was soft, pillow-top, the bathroom had double sinks. I enjoyed having the laundry facilities in the room! We were not aware of the housekeeping charges until we checked out. Had we known this, we would have just requested clean towels only. Overall, it was really nice and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Charging for housekeeping? Your kidding right?”
Reviews.Author: SactoScuba
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the room accommodations. But was really put off with the $23.95 request for daily housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great value”
Reviews.Author: nightowlmom
Reviews.Content: This is a great option for Branson lodging. We've stayed at many places over the years, from high end to low end and I think we've finally found our favorite. It was QUIET which is very important to me, each room is like an apartment, the location of the hotel is off Hwy 76 so you don't get that traffic. We didn't avail ourselves of all the activities offered, but it was nice that we had the option. Our room decor was a little dated but it was very CLEAN and roomy and the perfect place for our family of four. We rented the 1 bedroom suite, Room 5415 in building 5.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingHarleyGirl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very clean, nice place to stay, try this property.....there is plenty to do at the resort (swimming, fitness center, hot tubs, horsehoes, firepit, etc) but you are only minutes away from Rte. 76 if you want to catch the shows. There were four of us traveling together and there was plenty of space for all. Nice balconies to sit out on as well.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, very pleased in every way”
Reviews.Author: pvel
Reviews.Content: I visited with family. The hotel is set back from the street, so that it feels private even though it is in the heart of the city. the rooms are new and clean and well equipped. microwave, fridge, dvd player, toaster. there are several pools open till late. also activities, movies, tours etc. i did not avail of these activities but liked knowing that they were available. staff at chekin and out were friendly. great place. i have stayed at other good places in branson which were more expensive, but this one takes the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: lisca16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in one of the two bed/two bath villas with his two sisters, mom, niece and dad. One bedroom had a king size bed, the other had two double/queen size beds, and there was a sleeper sofa in the living room. Very nice full size kitchen with a dishwasher, microwave, oven, refrigerator, washer and dryer, utensils, dishwashing soap; everything but food! Dining table that seated six. Huge flat screen, flat screens in both bedrooms, nice furniture. Two baths, one in king size bedroom and the other connected to the other bedroom and the living room. The bathrooms were spacious and clean. Private balcony with a table and four chairs. Very nice lobby/check-in area. Indoor/outdoor pools, fitness room, game room with ping pong, pool, foosball, etc. The outdoor pool was huge, nice place to walk around. Also had a big shuffleboard game by the pool. We have decided to stay again, the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: fdwhite
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We had a 2 bedroom suite with more than ample room for our family or four plus my parents. We enjoyed the pool/recreation area and were pleasantly surprised by the event offerings of this resort. We will stay here again guaranteed!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Hillbillly
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite-type room. It was more like a fully furnished apartment than a hotel room. Two TVs, a full kitchen, a dining area with a big table and chairs, living room area with coffee table and sofa, nice bathroom, big balcony/porch area with a table and chairs... it was like a home away from home. Not bad for $129. The outdoor pool area was great, landscaped beautifully, and there was a lifeguard. Water volleyball and water basketball too. The hot tubs were even better, especially the outdoor ones. They're big and one curves around bushes so there's some seclusion from others in the jacuzzi. In total, between indoor and outdoor, there's two pools and three jacuzzis. They also have lots of activites and a fire pit. Plus, a basketball court, horseshoe pit and other things. (I don't think they have a fire every night though.) An activity schedule arrives outside the door in the morning, along with a morning paper. Nice. I really think this would be a great place to go with kids in the summer. The pool area would be a big hit, and then you'd get them to sleep! They do not have an ATM at the hotel, but they do have a very small convenience store at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “great resort for families”
Reviews.Author: Mom2QM
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Branson and used Tripadvisor for suggestions of where to stay. We were very pleased with the resort. Our teen really enjoyed the swimming pool and game room. We will definitely stay there again. It is not on the main road, so that helped with the traffic, although even on this road (the yellow route) the traffic was bad at show times.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing place!”
Reviews.Author: taylor31703
Reviews.Content: We had a change of plans mid-vacation and ended up in Branson for two nights. We pulled off the interestate, got online and found this hotel. We were the first to stay in the room we were assigned, so it was spotless and beautiful. It was a very small villa, but since it was only my 5-year-old son and I, we had enough room. I loved that the hotel was within walking distance of entertainment and restaurants. (Miniature golf was right at the entrance.) The resort itself had tons for kids to do even though the outdoor pool was not yet open for the season. If I could change anything, it would be to add a washer/dryer to the villa like the larger villas had. Also, our keys were made for only one night instead of two. We had to walk to the clubhouse to have them remade. Instead of just an apology and new keys, I was accused of putting the key next to my cell phone. Overall, it was a great stay. We were a short drive from a number of attractions, but away from all the commotion fo the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back to Branson just to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Beth76
Reviews.Content: Wow! I will willingly go back to Branson just to stay here again! We stayed here for 2 nights just to go to SDC. I wanted to avoid the strip at all costs. I couldn't believe how nice it was down on Green Mountain Rd. Lots of pretty condos and other hotels. Some stores and restaurants too so you could avoid the strip if you wanted. We had a 2 bedroom villa (for 5 people) and it was spectacular. For the price (180/night), we couldn't ask for anything more. The place was clean and modern, fully equipped kitchen, very comfortable beds. Very nice, plush beach towels too. It was so nice having the washer/dryer too. They even had laundry soap. I was hesitant to book at a timeshare place, not being an owner. I checked in like it was a regular resort. Not one person even mentioned the timeshare. The concierge sold us 2 days for the price of 1 tickets to SDC. No need to wait in line at the park. My kids loved the outdoor pool. We spent many hours down there. The indoor pool looked nice too, but we didn't use it. They had a small game room and a ton of board games that you could check out. They gave us a schedule for the week's activities, but we didn't get to do any of them. Would have loved to roast marshmallows at the campfire, but they didn't have it the nights we were there. The only possible downside I see is that it looked like they were going to be adding more buildings. If they add another pool, it should be fine. But if not, the current pool would be way too crowded. Even now, I could see it being too crowded during peak times. We were there early in the season and it wasn't a problem at all. I absolutely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: acatlover13
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort to stay in Branson. We had a one bedroom, one bath condo with full kitchen, nice balcony, washer and dryer and king size bed. The suite was incredibly roomy and had enough seating for twenty!! Although I saw some reviews about the property having thin walls, we did not experience this at all. We didn't find out until 3 days into our stay that someone was staying in the lock off unit attached to our unit! That's how quiet everything was. The only negative I might give the room, is it did not have a jacuzzi in the room. We didn't have to take advantage of the concierge services since we have family in the area and they helped us select shows and get discount tickets, but the concierge tables were manned every time I went there, so they seemed very accommodating. The location of this property was great as it was located on one of the "express routes" around the strip. Located on the "yellow route," we were able to get around the horrendous Branson strip traffic and connect easily to the "blue" and "red" routes and get everywhere we wanted in minutes. We didn't discover this until about two days into our stay, so we wasted a lot of time, but once we figured it out we really appreciated the location of this property. We didn't really use the pool, but it was beautiful and would be a great place for families to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Super Reaort!”
Reviews.Author: bwelliver
Reviews.Content: This was one great resort. Had everything you need for a fun vacation. Great indoor and outdoor pools and hottubs. Free pool and table tennis in the game room. The location was fine and within easy distance to the strip and all shows and attractions. Our room was very quiet! The staff was the best! We had a great time there and will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: Tam1969
Reviews.Content: I can't go back to staying at regular hotels again. This resort is incredible. I have a family of 5 which doesn't fit into a regular hotel room. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa and had lots of room. It was so clean and nicely decorated. The bed and pillows are the most comfortable that I've ever been in . The many pools on the site were wonderful especially the extra big heated jacuzzi. Customer service was the best. We especially enjoyed roasting hot dogs and making smores by the fire at night while getting to know other visitors and employees. Whenever we come to Branson again, this will be the only place we will stay. This is a 6 star resort! ******

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hoosierhiker
Reviews.Content: For less the $100 had a small unit that was great for two. Small efficiency kitchen with microwave and refrigerator, no stove. All utensils were furnished. Everything worked. Bed was comfortable. Location was great. Be sure to have a map as it is difficult to find. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ih1dnk
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here using a timeshare exchange, in a one bedroom setup. I have owned a timeshare for the last 6 years, and have probably stayed at a dozen resorts in that time. This was one of the best. The rooms are big, pillows are comfortable, everything looks new and clean. The kitchen was surprisingly large and well equipped. I am giving my experience 5 stars not just because of the room, but also because of all the activities they offer. The week we stayed there were terrible rain storms all but two days, and many of the activities we planned were rained out. It was so nice to bring my daughter to the indoor pool, or the planned craft activities. There were also coloring contests, movie nights on the big screen, and free popcorn in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Horizons by Marriott Vacation Club at Branson”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Dreammer
Reviews.Content: This year's mission for me was to find a place we hadn't been to before and that we could drive to. I had heard many good things about Branson for a family destination so that is where we chose to go. We have been owners with Marriott for many years but had never stayed at a Horizons before. So this was a new experience also. Positives: The resort was beautiful. Landscaping, pool, hot tubs, rooms all decorated nicely. The staff was amazing. So friendly and wanting to help make the stay perfect in any way they could. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath villa that was not a lock off and it was very comfortable for our family. We were very fortunate to have a room that over looked the pool. It was beautiful both in the day time and in the evening. Negatives: The concierge, while very helpful and willing to set up what ever activity you wanted, had not actually gone to the shows them self. We could hear all the noise from the rooms around us. The first few days we were there the people above would walk heavy and it would start at 6:30 a and go to 11 p. When I say heavy, I mean giant stomping heavy, wake you from deep sleep heavy. It was horrible. We had to beg to be moved to a different room. This was tough because the hotel was full but the manager finally made it happen. We got the room that the stompers were in. While moving from one room to the next we tried to simulate the stomping and we had to literally jump on the floor... but who knows. I personally blame the construction of the building for this. We have only had this problem in one other Marriott property. (Manor Club Sequel) After we changed rooms we only had the door slammings from the other villas. This was enough to rattle the pictures on the walls. Speaking of construction. Marriott is putting in a bunch of buildings. The actual construction was not noticed at all. Even though they were building every day we were there. The big down side to this I can see is that the pool will be way to small for the number of people the buildings are going to be able to hold. Lastly, there was no pool side service or resturant on site. This was a minor inconvenience since there were so many available in the area though.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend this resort”
Reviews.Author: mrsgaston
Reviews.Content: great resort for a great price. highly recommend it two families decided to take an overnight trip to branson this weekend. we knew we wanted an oversize hotel room and came upon this resort on the internet. it had two good sized bedrooms with a shared living room and kitchen. it was well appointed and had wonderful staff very willing to help in any way. the welcome center where you check in was a beautiful lodge setting that we would have loved to have had time to relax in. we were given a print out of all of the activities that were taking place during the day at the resort. if we hadn't already had plans we would have be thrilled just to stay there and take part in some fun family activities. the pool was an indoor heated pool and much to our surprise there was also a kiddie pool indoors. the outdoor pools were covered, but we can't wait til warm weather is here again to go experience those too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit, but won't be an owner.”
Reviews.Author: thewolffs
Reviews.Content: We are seasoned timeshare owners, and we booked this resort by exchanging our timeshare through Interval International. This is one of our better trades! Location, location, location! Horizons at Branson is a brand new resort right in the heart of Branson. We were very close to "the strip" and within walking distance to many attractions and local eateries (not that we walked it... we vacationed in the middle of December during two ice storms!). The grounds were very well kept and everything was so clean and new. We stayed in a two-bedroom villa where one of the bedrooms was a "lock-out" unit that could be closed off and rented out if we chose. We decided to bring my husband's parents instead. It worked out really well because the lock-out unit had its own sitting area and TV, bathroom, kitchenette, and separate entrance, so the parents could relax by themselves and feel like they were in their own little retreat away from the "kids". The villa was warm, inviting, beautifully decorated, and very spacious. Some of the things we like about Horizons by Marriott properties are the villa amenities such as the in-room laundry facilities and full kitchen. We didn't worry too much about bringing enough clothes because we were able to do laundry whenever we wanted. And, instead of going out to eat for every meal, the family just went out once a day and then took every other meal in the villa. We really felt like it was our home away from home! The amenities on the property were also very nice. Indoor and outdoor pools and jacuzzi, craft room, movie room... and the lobby was so beautiful. It had several little nooks and quiet seating areas to read or play a card game. They had DVDs for rent and a few snacks and toiletry items for sale in case you left something at home. (There is a large grocery store and a Wal-Mart about a half mile down the road, and that was very convenient, too, and a little more reasonably priced). The concierge service was very helpful during our stay. We had a few gaps in our itinerary and they were able to help us book extra shows. The resort also had a full activities schedule including activities such as crafts, ice cream socials, Texas Hold'em tournamants and, my husband's favorite, Blackjack tournaments. Many of these activities were free. While my vacation was wonderful, I don't know if I would buy a timeshare unit here. "The devil is in the details" when it comes to new construction, and this is not the best quality construction I've seen. One of the bathtubs was not installed level so the water would poor off the back ledge and down the wall and onto the floor no matter how careful you were to keep the shower off the back of the tub. There was already water damage and our building could not have been more than a year old (we did our best to towel dry the area after every shower, but not every guest is going to be so careful). Also, I went to hang a towel onto the towel rack in the main bathroom and the towel rack fell to the floor! You could see the drywall rubbed away under the spot where the towel rack was installed against the wall. The kitchen counters are laminated (not granite like I have typically seen in other Horizons by Marriot resorts) and they were already chipped, and someone had unfortunately used it as a cutting board and left gouges. But back to the positive stuff... this was a REALLY great place to stay. There is so much to do in Branson and we will come back someday. We'll even consider staying at Horizon's by Marriott again. It was so relaxing and clean, and the staff was so nice. I have already recommended this resort to many of my friends and co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: cmrtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our first family road trip to Branson. It took 9 hours and we were tired by the time we arrived but pleasantly surprised at the beautiful resort. We split our time share so we only had a studio room in Branson but it was more than enough room for us. The location was wonderful - a few blocks off the strip but easy to find everything in town. The grounds were beautiful and we especially loved the outdoor pool - my son (7 years old) never wanted to leave the pool. Had a few sprinkles one day and made use of the indoor pool then. Staff was very friendly and happy to help with anything or answer questions. Our first night was noisy due to neighbors above and beside us. We requested a room change the next morning and they met our needs immediately - never had a problem after that. Would definitely stay here again! Spend an afternoon at Moonshine Beach on Table Rock Lake ($4.00 per car). They have clean restrooms, playground and picnic pavillion and spotless beach - worth a trip there. Also, we spent an afternoon at the State Park Marina where we went on the Spirit of America Catamarran (2 hour trip). Well worth the $20 charge. They take you out to the middle of Table Rock Lake and tow a giant water trampoline, inflatable climbing iceberg and kayaks. Everyone is provided with life jackets and just jump in. We had a blast - definitely put on your agenda!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation at Horizons”
Reviews.Author: tiggrabb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom lock out unit for a week starting the Friday before Memorial weekend. The property was great. The grounds were immaculate and the units themselves were very clean and in very good condition. We had a washer/dryer in the main unit as well as a full kitchen. The lockout had a small fridge, microwave and dishes and glassware. Each side of the units had a sofa sleeper so 8 people could sleep in a 2 bedroom. The resort is still being built so it is small, but was definately not lacking in amenities. There was a large out door pool with 2 hot tubs as well as an indoor pool and another hot tub. Both area's also offered a dedictaed smakk childrens pool. The outside childrens pool had sprinklers at a walk in level which was nice.We enjoyed the game room which had among other things, fooseball, ping pong, pool and checkers. While we did not participate in any of the actual kids activities there seemed to be quite a few things to pick from. They even offered a campfire and smores one evening. The resort is very close to the strip and right up the hill from a go cart track and Pirates Cove mini golf. There was construction going on with the addition of another building coming soon so you will experience noise during the day starting around 8:00 A.M. Generally the construction stopped around 5:00. We enjoyed the nice BBQ area's on the property and my son and grandson enjoyed swimming. We spent quite a few of our days taking in Bransons attractions and shows and had some down time in the evenings. I would definately return to this resort again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: deanalang
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this wonderful vacation club. Rooms and condos were very nice, extremely clean. Everything we needed for a vacation was right at hand, several beautiful pools with waterfall, hot tubs, outdoor activities such as volleyball-shuffleboard etc. we epically enjoyed cooking on the outdoor grills and sitting by the fire ring at night near the pool. There were so many daily activities to choose from for all ages. The ice cream social by the pool was my favorite. The staff was outstanding and quite helpful. There are so many things close by for kids to do. What a great place for a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Horizons-Marriott - GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: mjhadley
