Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Branson. Our stay at the Horizons by Marriott was WONDERFUL!! Such a beatiful place and everyone was so accomodating and helpful. It is off the "strip" but easy access to everything - a wonderful place to get away from traffic and shows. The shows were great and you have to eat at the Hard Rock Diner. Food and entertainment are outstanding - we ate there 3 times. The new Branson Landing is a "must see" - OUTSTANDING. Save your money on the train ride - food was adequate but what you saw from train was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: IAStateFan
Reviews.Content: We traded our timeshare with Interval International to book at Horizons because we wanted a vacation close to home (Kansas City). We stayed for 5 nights over Labor Day weekend. I was pleasantly suprised that the resort (especially the pool area) never seamed too crowded. The pool area was very nice. The pool seamed a bit chilly so we spent most of our time in the Kiddie pool with our 2 year old (we were always the only ones in it). Our one-bedroom villa was nice and very spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed to cook most of our meals in-house. We went to the grocery store and bought some steaks to cook out on there grills. My only complaints: 1) Their play area for children was simply a slide. The indoor play area their website mentions wasn't open at any time we tried to enter. 2) No on-site restaurant or grill(I think they had a few snacks available at the pool cabana which was only open from 11-3). The location is good, but the main street in front of the resort was often very busy and it was difficult to get to and from the resort during busy traffic (as with most places in branson).

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ealicia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a a very nice vacation in Branson. Horizons was nice, clean and close to all shows and activities. The main problem we had was that the cielings and floors were so poorly constructed that the stomping and running of the kids staying above us and next to us kept us up until almost midnight on most of our 7 day stay. The staff was of no help with this problem and so we had to put up with the shaking and rattling of the cielings. If you are a family with lots of kids and don't mind the noise this is the place for you. If you are interested in some R&R and REAL down time, I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Horizon's is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: letsgosomewhere99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent five nights with one more to go at Horizon's. The place is wonderful. We have a studio room which is plenty for the two of us. We have a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, small sink, dishes, small dining table, sofa and queen size bed. The bathroom is a nice size. The place is VERY clean. I don't think you'll find a friendlier staff anywhere else in Branson - everyone we've come in contact with has been so nice. Being off of the main strip, it is nice and quiet, peaceful. They have a beautiful pool area. Outdoor pool has an area in the pool you can play volleyball or basketball, plenty of lounge chairs, small kiddie pool, whirlpool. They also have an indoor pool and whirlpool. Plenty of activities - pool table, ping pong, board games, etc. Nice fitness room. We had planned on staying four nights, but decided to extend it two additional nights which the front desk was very accomodating in arranging that. Very affordable rates. I believe you would be more than pleased staying at Horizon's by Marriott. You must eat at Mel's Hard Luck Diner which is not far from the hotel (located in Grand Village) food is great and you will hear some awesome singers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MargeS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Horizons by Marriott for four nights with my elderly mother and aunt. We had a two-bedroom, two-bath villa. Accommodations were excellent - spacious, airy, and very clean. Front desk staff were very responsive and polite. Location is excellent - quiet surroundings off the strip but convenient to theaters, shopping, and restaurants. All in all, great stay, with one minor complaint: The guest bedroom with two queen-size beds does not have a window that opens to allow fresh air to circulate. There is a non-opening window that overlooks the exterior entrance/hallway. The room can get very hot and does not have a ceiling fan, although the master suite has a ceiling fan as well as a "real" window.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've ever stayed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am still reeling from the wonderful experience my family and I had during this vacation. I have never stayed in such an absolutely wonderful place. We stayed in a 2BR/2BA Villa on the 5th floor, and I could not have asked for more in a hotel. It was more than a hotel. This place was like a home away from home. It was huge!! The kitchen has everything you would need even a blender! There was a dishwasher, a full set of dishes, pots and pans, even the refrigerator had an automatic ice maker in the freezer. My 2 kids had their own room and each had a queen size bed and their own t.v. The master suite had its own stand alone shower and a king size bed. Plenty of closet space throughout. The decor was so stylish and up to date, but I can't tell you how much of a wonderful experience this was. This place has everything you could possibly need and even though it doesn't have its own on-site restaurant, they don't need it really. There are so many places to eat around there it didn't bother us at all. Plus, there is a grocery store and wal-mart in the same parking lot just a few blocks from the resort. You don't even have to get back on Hwy 76 to get to the shopping center. We will recommend this place to anyone and everyone, and will definitely go back. I will never want to stay anywhere else, and I was actually sad to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Masonpips
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 26-28 and absolutely loved it. We went to Silver Dollar City first and then left when it got busy and checked in. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the 3rd floor of building #1. When my husband and kids walked in they said "WOW". It was huge and fully equipped. The kitchen was enoromous and we went out to get breakfast foods to have each morning. The kids slept on the sofa bed in the living room and it seemed larger than normal (more like a queen versus a double) and the bed in the bedroom was nice! Great comforter, lighting, tv location. We wandered the lobby/activities area one evening and there were lots of people in the indoor pool, others doing crafts, others playing pool or ping-pong. They had a book swap and several puzzles going on in various locations. All in all, a very enjoyable stay and a lovely place!

Reviews.Title: “A Week in Branson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family spent a week, Nov. 19-26, 2005 at the Horizons of Marriott in Branson, Mo. with the most wonderful accomodations and week full of the best entertainment anyone could ever have experienced. As an owner of the Horizons for only about a year, this was our first stay with the Marriott in Branson. Part of our family stayed the first of the week and remaining family joined us for the Thanksgiving weekend. The villa was just lovely. Decorated with great colors and every accomodation needed, just like home! We used the kitchen to prepare the entire Thanksgiving dinner as if we were at home. This was the most perfect time to visit Branson with all the many many Christmas shows and light displays everywhere. We are still amazed at the millions & millions of lights at Silver Dollar City. It truly got you in the Christmas spirit. We enjoyed the Pierce Arrow show and Shoi Tabushi show so very much as well as Andy Williams & The Legends. The Branson Belle served a great lunch and the Christmas show was good too. The weather was actually good as well. Warmer than back in central Illinois that week. We were not aware that the day after Thanksgiving is the big day to shop in Branson too!!!! Overall, we just enjoy Branson for everything it has to offer. This was our mother's first visit to Branson and even though she was very tired when she returned home, she stated this was the BEST vacation she had ever had. I would suggest this to be a vacation spot everyone should experience once in a lifetime. Horizons of Marriott can also give you a beautiful place to stay. Thank you Branson, Mo!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lynk11
Reviews.Content: A great location giving you easy access to the Branson attractions and relaxing location to rest and recuperate. Very friendly staff helped make our stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, needs polish on service”
Reviews.Author: ajavagal
Reviews.Content: I visited this property alone with three children (16 mos, 5 yr, 11 yr), it was my first time at a Horizons brand (although we are Plat. Marriott Rewards members). Not an owner, we just rented a guest room on-line as no villas were available. I found the front desk service lacking a lot, before I could finish a question about their on-site provisions (aka milk), I was cut off and was told to go directly to Wal-Mart! I was not impressed. Basically, the front desk was not helpful at all throughout the stay. The Concierge desk was helpful in getting theatre tickets (after 2 calls and a visit). A plus, was a free Branson-Springfield coupon book. As it was the end of Oct, only the indoor pool with tiny kid pool & spa was open. All outdoor pool areas were closed (not on the web-site). A kids play area was only open from 9-5, and we never got to visit it. The property is new with only 2 accomodation buildings at present. I do not recommend the guest rooms for any group other than a couple. It's just way too cramped. Ours didn't have a tub in the bath only a shower, which was a problem as the baby screams in a shower. The room was clean and well styled. The bed very comfortable! The mini-fridge was not working correctly and I had difficulty getting all the baby bottle supplies in it. Traveling alone with kids is a challenge, but it was hard getting all of our things inside & out in the light rain. Someone came by in a cart and helped a couple get their things in, but no offer to us or others. No laundry in guest rooms but free use of a washer/dryer in the building. I did notice an outdoor area with BBQ grills. The maid came in daily as we were renters, not owners and cleaned up somewhat, but not as I would except and she was rude one day when we were still in the room when she wanted to clean. When we left the room just before 11 am, she made the comment "can I finally get in." Green Mountain road is a great location when visiting Branson, easy to access the feeder roads to just about everywhere and avoid hwy 76 (which is a parking lot in summer! No kidding). Just off the property is Pirates Cove, a miniature golf course the kids enjoyed. We also rode the ducks (as a old-timer to Branson, I had never done this, but the kids insisted!) and it was fun and worth the cost (use a coupon). Near the Days Inn is a great Mexican Restaurant (authenic food and low prices, plus we used a coupon from the book.) Krispy Kreme, McD's, Denney's quick for Breakfast. No food at all on property (except popcorn in the lobby, lol!). Get your show tickets at the Concierge desk. Use the feeder roads. Use the coupon book or coupons from brochures available everywhere (including wal-mart). Overall the property is very nice, staff need more training in service, room well-kept, comfortable & clean. Get at least 1 bedroom villa with 4 people. Will probably try this property again in warmer weather and hope the staff are nicer.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott's Willow Ridge Lodge
HotelInfo.Address: 2929 Green Mountain Dr, Branson, MO 65616
